Output controller for controlling data output of a synchronous semiconductor memory device
column13: An output controller includes: an output enable signal generator for generating corresponding ones among a plurality of output enable signals based on a preset column address strobe (CAS) latency, each of the output enable signals having information relating to a delay time from an activation timing of a CAS signal; and an output driving signal generator for receiving the plurality of output enable signals corresponding to the preset CAS latency and outputting rising and falling output driving signals for controlling an output timing of data.

column12: Delay locked loop circuit
column13: A synchronous memory device having a normal mode and a power down mode includes a power down mode controller for generating a power down mode control signal in response to a clock enable signal, thereby determining onset or termination of a power down mode. A clock buffering unit buffers an external clock signal in response to the power down mode control signal and outputs first and second internal clock signals. A clock selection unit selects one of the first and second internal clock signals based on the power down mode control signal to output the selected signal as an intermediate output clock signal. A phase update unit performs a phase update operation by using the intermediate output clock signal to output a delay locked loop (DLL) clock signal, the first internal clock signal differing in frequency from the second internal clock signal.

column12: Semiconductor memory device and method of operating the same
column13: Provided herein are a semiconductor memory device and a method of operating the same. The semiconductor memory device includes: a memory cell array including a plurality of memory cells; a peripheral circuit configured to control the memory cell array, the peripheral circuit including a first region disposed under the memory cell array and a second region; and a fall sensing unit configured to sense whether a failure has occurred in the first or the second regions.

column12: OUTPUT CONTROL DEVICE
column13: An output controller includes a test unit, which can test an appropriate delay amount according to an operating frequency under a real situation. The output controller includes: an output enable signal generator for generating corresponding ones among a plurality of output enable signals based on a preset column address strobe (CAS) latency, each of the output enable signals having information relating to a delay time from an activation timing of a CAS signal; and an output driving signal generator for receiving the plurality of output enable signals corresponding to the preset CAS latency and outputting rising and falling output driving signals for controlling an output timing of data.

column12: AERIAL LADDER TRUCK
column13: 본 발명의 고가 사다리차는 붐대 및 상기 붐대와 연결되는 복수의 사다리단을 포함하는 사다리부; 상기 사다리부와 연결되어 길이 조절을 통해 상기 사다리부의 각도를 조절하는 유압 붐; 상기 붐대에 부착되며, 레이저를 출력하여 상기 레이저의 비행 시간을 이용해 상기 목표 지점까지의 거리를 계산하고, 상기 목표 지점까지의 거리 정보를 외부 기기로 전송하는 적어도 하나의 레이저 장치; 및 상기 고가 사다리차의 사용자가 상기 레이저 장치에서 출력된 레이저가 향하는 지점을 인식하여 상기 유압 붐을 통해 상기 사다리부의 각도를 조절하도록 상기 유압 붐을 제어하고, 상기 레이저 장치로부터 수신한 상기 목표 지점까지의 거리 정보에 기초하여 상기 복수의 사다리단을 연장시키도록 상기 사다리부를 제어하는 사다리 제어 장치를 포함할 수 있다.

column12: METHOD OF WRITING TEST DATA TO RECORDING ELEMENT AND RECORDING-ELEMENT TESTING CIRCUIT
column13: PURPOSE: To improve data writing speed by conducting a MOS transistor without going through an input/output line and imparting a load directly to one bit line only. CONSTITUTION: A circuit for testing a recording element is controlled by a control circuit 1. One MOS transistor is selected from plural MOS transistors M1-M4 connecting to a pair of bit lines 2, 3 on which data consisting of binary codes propagate. A load for data is directly imparted to one bit line through the MOS transistor thus selected. The data is stored by being transferred directly to a capacitor inside a memory cell 5 connecting to the bit line to which the load is imparted. Thus, the load for data is directly transferred to the capacitor inside the memory cell and stored, therefore, time for a RAM test can be shortened.

column12: Semiconductor memory apparatus
column13: A semiconductor memory apparatus includes a phase comparator configured to compare phases of rising and falling feedback clocks with that of a reference clock, a delay circuit configured to delay the reference clock by a predetermined time based on a comparison result of the phase comparator to thereby generate rising and falling delayed clocks, a clock transmission block configured to invert the rising delayed clock outputted from the delay circuit when the rising and falling feedback clocks have substantially different phases, a duty compensator configured to compensate a duty ratio from outputs of the clock transmitting block to generate a delay locked clock having a compensated duty ratio, and a delay model configured to delay an output and an inverse output of the duty compensator by a modeled delay time respectively to generate the rising and falling feedback clocks.

column12: DISPLAY APPARATUS AND CONTROL METHOD THEREOF
Alkaline Water Electrolysis System
column13: An alkaline water electrolysis system comprises: a plurality of reaction chambers, each including a main electrode and an auxiliary electrode; a piston installed to change a volume of the reaction chamber through reciprocating motion; a drive motor; a connecting rod and a crankshaft installed to change rotational motion of the drive motor into reciprocating linear motion of the piston; a plurality of gas valves installed on an upper side of the reaction chamber to discharge hydrogen and oxygen generated in the reaction chamber through different paths, respectively; a pressure sensor installed in the reaction chamber; a controller configured to open and close the gas valves in response to a signal received from the pressure sensor; and an electrolyte supply apparatus provided to supply an electrolyte to the reaction chambers. According to the present invention, it is possible to produce hydrogen with a simple configuration.

column12: DELAY LOCKED LOOP CIRCUIT AND DELAY LOCK METHOD OF THE SAME
column13: The present invention relates to a delay locked loop circuit capable of improving phase shift performance. The delay locked loop circuit comprises: a variable delay unit configured to delay an input clock signal as much as a varied delay time in response to a delay control signal at a timing corresponding to an update cycle signal and generate a delay locked loop clock signal; a delay model configured to delay the delay locked loop clock signal for a predetermined delay time and generate a feedback clock signal; a phase detection unit configured to output, as the delay control signal, the result of detecting the phase of the feedback clock signal, based on a reference clock signal; and an update cycle control unit configured to determine whether to change an update cycle in response to an external clock signal and the delay control signal, and change the generation cycle of the update cycle signal depending on the determination results. [Reference numerals] (300) Variable delay unit; (400) Delay model; (500) Phase detection unit; (600) Update cycle control unit; (610) Cycle change determination unit; (620) Cycle signal generation unit; (700) Phase separation unit

column12: REGISTER CONTROLLED DELAY LOCKED LOOP CIRCUIT
column13: A register controlled delay locked loop (DLL) circuit, including: a phase comparator configured to compare phases of a source clock and a feedback clock with each other, and a clock delay circuit configured to delay a phase of an internal clock synchronized with a clock edge of the source clock in response to an output signal of the phase comparator. The clock delay circuit delays the phase of the internal clock using first delay units for a predetermined delay duration, and thereafter delays the phase of the internal clock using second delay units, the second delay unit providing a longer delay than the first delay unit. A delay replica model is configured to reflect actual delay conditions of the source clock in an output clock of the clock delay circuit to output the feedback clock.

column12: CHILLER, AND MANUFACTURING METHOD OF THE CHILLER
column13: PURPOSE: A chiller and a manufacturing method for the same are provided to remove fine assembly tolerances between cool blocks and a heat exchanger by fixing cool blocks to a jig, processing into a regular height, and closely attaching to the heat exchanger. CONSTITUTION: A manufacturing method for a chiller comprises the following steps: arranging a plurality of thermoelectric elements on one or both sides of a radiation plate to be in touch with each other by the surface; mounting a cool block(24) on the top of a thermoelectric element; fixing the cool block and thermoelectric element on a radiation plate by exposing the cool block; fixing the radiation plate to a jig(G) and processing the exposed cool blocks into a regular height in order to homogenize flatness; and fixing the cool blocks on the outer side of a heat exchanger to be in touch with each other by the surface for fixing the radiation plate to one or both sides of the heat exchanger.

column12: Voltage boosting circuit of semiconductor memory device
METHOD, APPARATUS, AND SYSTEM FOR DECIPHERING MEDIA CONTENT STREAM
column13: A method, apparatus and system for media content deciphering is disclosed. In one embodiment, a first content stream is received at a receiver device from a transmitter device coupled to the receiver device, wherein the first content stream having media content formatted in a particular package structure, the media content is associated with High-Definition Content Protection (HDCP) values. The first content stream is deciphered into a second content stream by removing the HDCP values from the first content stream, while the package structure of the media content is maintained.

column12: Integrated circuit
column13: An integrated circuit includes a clock control unit configured to selectively output an external clock or a delayed clock acquired by delaying the external clock as an input clock in response to a divided clock generated by dividing the external clock, when a test mode is entered; and an internal circuit operating in response to the input clock.

column12: Delay locked loop circuit
column13: A DLL circuit and a synchronous memory device perform stable operation in a power down mode although the entry and exit into/from the power down mode is repeated rapidly. The synchronous memory device operates in a normal mode and a power down mode. A delay locked loop (DLL) generates a DLL clock having frozen locking information when exiting the power down mode. A controller precludes phase update operation of the DLL when a predetermined time passes after entering the power down mode to thereby obtain a time margin for a phase update operation undertaken in the normal mode.

column12: MICRO RFID TAG FOR WINE ANTI FORGERY
column13: PURPOSE: A micro radio frequency identification (RFID) tag for wine forgery protection is provided to use a tin cap seal, a wine bottle cap, as an antenna to operate the RFID tag more stably, thereby improving the performance of the product. CONSTITUTION: A micro RFID tag for wine forgery protection comprises a cover sheet (1), a label tag, and an adhesive (4). The cover sheet consists of a field effect transistor (FET) material. The label tag comprises a resonant circuit printed pattern (2) including an RFID integrated circuit (IC) chip (3) in the rear of the cover sheet. The adhesive is provided in the rear of the label tag to attach the RFID tag.

column13: The present invention relates to a method for creating and managing an own representative image to replace a representative image of a product for online market sales and a detailed image into an own representative image and, more specifically, to a method for creating and managing a product image of a product for online market sales to create an individual image produced with own concept differentiated from other sellers for each produce sold on online market and matching an individual image with corresponding product information to manage a product.

column12: TWO-FLUID INJECTOR
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a novel and improved two-fluid injector in which an injection part can be easily separated and assembled.SOLUTION: A two-fluid injector includes: a housing which is connected to a housing body and seals a second inflow space part; a head part 210 in which an upper part which is provided with a vertically penetrating hollow part and penetrates a first inflow space part and which is so coupled to an upper part of the housing body that the hollow part is communicated with the second inflow space part and a second fluid is supplied to the hollow part from the second inflow space part, an intermediate part 212 which is coupled to a lower part of the housing body and is provided with a first fluid supply hole 212a which is communicated with the first inflow space part and is so formed as to be long in a vertical direction, and a lower part are integrally formed, and by which the first fluid and the second fluid are respectively separated from the housing and are supplied; and a second injection part 220 which is separably coupled to the head part and by which the first fluid supplied to the first fluid supply hole and the second fluid supplied to the hollow part are mixed and are injected.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 9

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a semiconductor memory device equipped with a control circuit capable of properly controlling a delay fixed circuit in various operation modes of a memory device.

SOLUTION: This device includes a clock buffer for receiving a system clock from the outside to output it to an internal clock, a delay fixed circuit for controlling the delay of the internal clock so as to synchronize data output timing with the system clock, a data output buffer for outputting data in synchronization with the delay-fixed internal clock, and a clock buffer control unit equipped with a latch for outputting an enable signal to control turning on/off of the clock buffer, and obtaining different logical levels of the enable signal according to the state of a previous operation in response to the control signal of the same logical level.

column12: METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR DECIPHERING MEDIA CONTENT STREAM
column13: A method, apparatus and system for pre-authenticating ports is disclosed. In one embodiment, an active port facilitating communication of media content between a transmitting device and a receiving device is identified, while the active port are associated with a first High-Definition Content Protection (HDCP) engine. Then, inactive ports that are in idle mode serving as backup ports to the active port are identified, while the inactive ports are associated with a second HDCP engine. Pre-authentication of each of the inactive ports is performed so the pre-authenticated inactive ports can subsequently replace the active port if a port switch is performed.

column12: Back light apparatus and control method thereof
column13: A back light apparatus includes a back light part (200) which emits light to a liquid crystal display panel (100), and includes a plurality of LEDs respectively corresponding to a plurality of colors, a detecting part (220) which detects the light emitted from the plurality of the LEDs, a driving part (300) which drives the LEDs to emit, and a controller (400) which controls the driving part (300) to make color ratios substantially equal to a reference value if the reference value is not equal to the color ratio between at least two colors among the plurality of colors of the light detected in the detecting part (220).

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR DEVICE
column13: A semiconductor device may include a delay line including a first group of unit delay cells and a second group of unit delay cells. The first group of unit delay cells and the second group of unit delay cells may be configured for delaying a phase of a clock by a unit cycle of a reference frequency. The reference frequency may serve as a reference for distinguishing between a first frequency and a second frequency. The semiconductor device may include a reservoir capacitor located adjacent to one or more of the unit delay cells of the first group. Only the first group of the unit delay cells may be used to delay the phase of the clock.

column12: SHIFT CONTROL SYSTEM FOR AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION ON VEHICLE AND METHOD THEREOF
column13: Disclosed are a transmission control device and a control method using same. The brake oil temperature which is measured by using a temperature sensor is compared to a reference temperature value so a driver is warned of vapor lock in advance. Driving information such as a current vehicle speed and a brake pedal amount are collected so the number of gear shifts is determined in view thereof. Accordingly, downshifting is performed in view of not only the brake oil temperature but also the vehicle speed and the brake pedal amount, and thus gearshift can be safe and a vapor lock-free and optimum engine brake can be attained.

column12: METHOD, APPARATUS AND SYSTEM FOR DECIPHERING MEDIA CONTENT STREAM
column13: A method, apparatus and system for media content deciphering is disclosed. In one embodiment, a first content stream is received at a receiver device from a transmitter device coupled to the receiver device, wherein the first content stream having media content formatted in a particular package structure, the media content is associated with High-Definition Content Protection (HDCP) values. The first content stream is deciphered into a second content stream by removing the HDCP values from the first content stream, while the package structure of the media content is maintained.

column12: DELAY LOCKED LOOP CIRCUIT WITH DUTY CYCLE CORRECTION FUNCTION AND METHOD OF CONTROLLING THE SAME
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To conduct an accurate delay locking operation and duty cycle correction regardless of a change in PVT.

SOLUTION: A delay locked loop circuit comprises a delay locked loop block, a duty cycle correcting block 200, and an error determination unit. The delay locked loop block receives external clocks to generate first internal clocks. The first internal clocks are delayed by an internal delay means to output a plurality of second internal clocks and upon its feedback, the delay locked loop block adjusts a delay time of the delay means according to a phase difference between each second internal clock and the reference clock so that the second internal clocks are delay locked. The duty cycle correcting block 200 corrects a duty cycle of each second internal clock and outputs a duty cycle corrected clock. The error determination unit determines the occurrence of a duty correction error in accordance with a result of comparing a phase of each second internal clock with one another and feeds back one of the duty cycle corrected clock or the second internal clock to the delay locked loop block.

COPYRIGHT: (C)2008,JPO&INPIT

column12: DISPLAY APPARATUS AND CONTROL METHOD THEREOF
column13: A display apparatus and a method of controlling a display apparatus are disclosed. The display apparatus includes: a display configured to display an image based on a video signal; a sound output section configured to output a first sound based on a sound signal; a first sound receiver configured to receive a first mixed sound including the first sound and a second sound of a user; a second sound receiver which is spaced apart at a distance from the first sound receiver and is configured to receive a second mixed sound comprising the first sound and the second sound; and a controller configured to perform control in accordance with the second sound of the user, the second sound being acquired based on the first mixed sound and the second mixed sound.

column12: Delay locked loop circuit
column13: A DLL circuit and a synchronous memory device perform stable operation in a power down mode although the entry and exit into/from the power down mode is repeated rapidly. The synchronous memory device operates in a normal mode and a power down mode. A delay locked loop (DLL) generates a DLL clock having frozen locking information when exiting the power down mode. A controller precludes phase update operation of the DLL when a predetermined time passes after entering the power down mode to thereby obtain a time margin for a phase update operation undertaken in the normal mode.

column12: Alkaline Water Electrolysis System
column13: The present invention includes: a plurality of cylinders each having a main electrode and an auxiliary electrode; a piston installed to slide linearly according to a change in pressure of the cylinder; a crank arm and a crankshaft installed to convert a linear sliding motion of the piston into rotational motion; a gas valve device installed above the cylinder to discharge hydrogen and oxygen generated in the cylinder through different paths; and an electrolyte supply device provided to supply electrolyte to the cylinder. Thus, the present invention can be combined with a wide range of energy generators to produce hydrogen.

column12: Method for maintaining period goods for discount
column13: The present invention relates to a method for managing sale goods for a period, and more particularly, to a method for managing sale goods for a period, capable of providing a user with a list of goods that can be sold by a market and a sale type for each of the goods sold on an online market or an offline market and providing the user with a much lower price than other sellers for a corresponding period by providing the user with a periodical use right for the corresponding goods if the user selects specific goods, thereby providing a customer with the goods with a lower price and providing a seller with the increase in sales and profitability.

column12: Semiconductor memory apparatus
column13: A semiconductor memory apparatus may include a clock buffer configured to receive an external clock signal, buffer the external clock signal in response to an activation control signal, and the clock buffer configured to output an internal clock signal in response to an activation control signal. The semiconductor memory apparatus may also include a delay-locked loop block configured to receive the internal clock signal outputted from the clock buffer and compare phases of the internal clock signal and a feedback clock signal, and responsively generate a delay-locked clock signal. The semiconductor memory apparatus may also include an operation control block configured to responsively generate the activation control signal which is received by the clock buffer in accordance with a result of comparing the phases of the internal clock signal and the feedback clock signal, in response to receiving a read signal.

column12: DELAY LOCKED LOOP CIRCUIT AND SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE USING THE SAME
column13: The present invention relates to a delay locked loop (DLL) circuit. The DLL circuit includes a phase comparator configured to compare a phase of a source clock with a phase of a feedback clock and generate a delay locking signal based on the comparison result, a clock delay configured to delay the source clock in response to the delay locking signal for locking delay, output the delayed source clock as a delay locked clock, and generate a delay end signal when a delay amount has reached a delay limit, a delay replica model configured to reflect a delay time of an output path of the source clock at the delay locked clock and output the reflected clock as the feedback clock, and a delay locking operation controller configured to terminate a delay locking operation in response to the delay locking signal and the delay end signal.

column12: INFORMATION LEAKAGE MITIGATION ASSOCIATED WITH ELLIPTIC CURVE OPERATIONS
column13: Various techniques are provided to implement information leakage mitigation associated with elliptic curve operations. In one example, a method includes generating second data based on first data. The first data is associated with a message. The second data is associated with a decoy message. The method further includes performing a first elliptic curve operation based on the first data. The method further includes performing a second elliptic curve operation based on the second data. The first elliptic curve operation and the second elliptic curve operation are performed in a random order. Related systems and devices are provided.

column12: Delay locked loop circuit with duty cycle correction and method of controlling the same
column13: A delay locked loop block receives external clocks to generate first internal clocks including a reference clock. An internal delay unit delays the first internal clocks to output second internal clocks, which are fed back to the delay locked loop block. The delay locked loop block adjusts delay time of the delay unit according to a phase difference between each second internal clock and the reference clock so that the second internal clocks are delay locked. A duty cycle correcting block corrects a duty cycle of each second internal clock and outputs a duty cycle corrected clock. An error determining unit compares a phase of each second internal clock with one another and, based on the comparison, feeds back a feedback clock including one of the duty cycle corrected clock or the second internal clock to the delay locked loop block.

column12: OUTPUT TIMING CONTROL CIRCUIT AND SEMICONDUCTOR APPARATUS USING THE SAME
column13: An output timing control circuit of a semiconductor apparatus includes a delay amount counter block configured to count a delay amount of an output reset pulse signal based on an external clock signal and output a first counting code, wherein the delay amount counter block is configured to control the delay amount of the output reset pulse signal depending upon a frequency of the external clock signal; an operation block configured to subtract a code value of the first counting code from a code value of a data output delay code, and output a delay control code; and a phase control block configured to control a phase of a read command signal by the number of clocks of a DLL clock signal corresponding to a code value of the delay control code, and output an output enable flag signal.

column12: Delay locked loop circuit
GUIDING ROBOT SYSTEM WITH AIR CLEANING FUNCTION
column13: PURPOSE: A guide robot system with an air cleaning function is provided to exactly and safely perform the air cleaning function by controlling the movement of a robot based on a surrounding situation. CONSTITUTION: A guide robot system with an air cleaning function comprises a robot control station(10) and a guide robot(20). The robot control station sets and changes a traveling route of the guide robot, a guide point in the traveling route, and multimedia information for each guide point based on location information in a program. The robot control station controls the guide robot by communicating based on a control command and data. The guide robot autonomously runs according to the control command, and provides the corresponding information to the guide point. The guide robot comprises an air cleaning unit(206) and a floor dust suction unit(207). The air cleaning unit is mounted to the guide robot, and collecting dust with moving along the traveling route of the guide robot. The floor dust suction unit scatters and collects the dust.

column12: REGISTER CONTROLLED DELAY LOCKED LOOP CIRCUIT
column13: PURPOSE: A register controlled delay locked loop circuit is provided to prevent a jitter having the big value in the clock through the delay locking operation. CONSTITUTION: The register controlled delay locked loop circuit includes the phase comparison and the clock delay and the delay replication model. The phase comparison compares the phase of the source clock and feedback clock. The clock delay delays the phase of the internal clock corresponded to the clock edge of the source clock in response to the output signal of the phase comparison means. The clock delay delays the delay amount to the predetermined delay amount by first delay unit. The delay replication model outputs as the feedback clock by reflecting the real delay condition of the source clock.

column12: METHOD OF GENERATING DELAY LOCKED LOOP CLOCK FOR PREVENTING LOCKING FAILURE, AND APPARATUS THEREOF
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a delay locked loop apparatus for preventing the occurrence of locking failure due various changes in environment such as the temperature of a chip when relatively long-time power down mode remains.

SOLUTION: The apparatus includes a power down mode control unit for generating a control signal determining entrance or exit into or from the power down mode; a first clock buffer for buffering an external clock in a normal mode based on the control signal to generate a first internal clock signal; a second clock buffer for buffering the external clock in a power down mode based on the control signal to generate a second internal clock signal; a clock selecting unit for selecting the first internal clock signal in the normal mode based on the control signal and selecting the second internal clock signal in the power down mode and transmitting the selected signal; and a phase updating unit for using the signal selected by the clock selecting unit to execute phase update, thereby outputting a DLL clock.

COPYRIGHT: (C)2007,JPO&INPIT

column12: DLL CIRCUIT AND DELAY-LOCKED METHOD USING THE SAME
column13: A delay-locked loop (DLL) circuit having improved phase correction performance includes a variable delay unit configured to generate a DLL clock signal by delaying an input clock signal by a varied delay time in response to a delay control signal at timing corresponding to an update cycle signal, a delay model configured to generate a feedback clock signal by delaying the DLL clock signal for a predetermined delay time, a phase detection unit configured to output a result of the detection of the phase of the feedback clock signal based on a reference clock signal as the delay control signal, and an update cycle control unit configured to determine whether a cycle has been shifted or not in response to an external clock signal and the delay control signal and shift a cycle where the update cycle signal is generated based on a result of the determination.

column12: Integrated circuit
column13: An integrated circuit includes a clock control unit configured to selectively output an external clock or a delayed clock acquired by delaying the external clock as an input clock in response to a divided clock generated by dividing the external clock, when a test mode is entered; and an internal circuit operating in response to the input clock.

column12: DLL circuit and method of controlling the same
column13: A DLL circuit includes a buffer control unit configured to detect whether or not a DLL power supply exceeds a reference level and output a buffer control signal. A clock buffer buffers an external clock to generate an internal clock when the buffer control signal is enabled.

METHOD FOR REDUCING CONSUMPTION CURRENT OF ELECTRIC HYDRAULIC POWER STEERING
column13: PURPOSE: A motor controlled hydraulic power steering system for reducing power consumption is provided to improve the fuel ratio of a vehicle by controlling an amount of a motor control current according to the velocity of a vehicle, an angular speed of ration and motor current. CONSTITUTION: It determines whether a user operates a steering wheel when an engine is started(S210). If the steering wheel is operated, motor current is lower than standard value and the vehicle enters a sleep mode if the speed of the vehicle and the angular speed of the rotation are lower than the predetermined value(S212).

column12: METHOD FOR DETERMINING OVERSAMPLED DATA TO BE INCLUDED IN UNIT INTERVALS
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide circuits, methods, and systems for determining which oversampled data are to be part of different groups of oversampled data (unit intervals) used in determining the values of bits of a received signal.

SOLUTION: In some embodiments, a chip includes sampling circuitry to produce oversampled data from a received signal, and logic to determine which of the oversampled data are to be part of different unit intervals, wherein some of the unit intervals have a number of oversampled data that is different from a number of oversampled data typically included in the unit intervals. Other embodiments are described and claimed.

column13: A semiconductor memory apparatus includes a phase comparator configured to compare phases of rising and falling feedback clocks with that of a reference clock, a delay circuit configured to delay the reference clock by a predetermined time based on a comparison result of the phase comparator to thereby generate rising and falling delayed clocks, a clock transmission block configured to invert the rising delayed clock outputted from the delay circuit when the rising and falling feedback clocks have substantially different phases, a duty compensator configured to compensate a duty ratio from outputs of the clock transmitting block to generate a delay locked clock having a compensated duty ratio, and a delay model configured to delay an output and an inverse output of the duty compensator by a modeled delay time respectively to generate the rising and falling feedback clocks.

column12: ONE TOUCH REBAR COUPLER
column13: The present invention relates to a one-touch type steel bar coupler, which includes: a pair of coupler bodies having a hollow shape, in which a body coupling portion having a thread is formed at an inner surface of one end thereof, a steel bar perforation portion is formed at the other end thereof, and contact portions, which are formed with inclined surfaces and horizontal surfaces continuously arranged from the other end to the one end, are formed at an inner surface thereof; a joint member disposed in the body coupling portion of the coupler body, formed on an outer surface thereof with a thread for screw-coupling, provided at a center thereof with a joint member operating portion for rotational operation, and provided with a steel bar insertion portion formed on both sides of the joint member operating portion; a plurality of plate members arranged inside the coupler body, in which outer surfaces of the plate members are formed with inclined surfaces and horizontal surfaces arranged from the other end to one end of the plate members, and a plurality of locking protrusions are formed on inner surfaces of the plate members such that a joint of the steel bar can be supported while being hooked with the locking protrusions; and an elastic member interposed between the joint member and the plate member. According to the present invention, by changing the structure of the coupler body, the conventional holder is removed, and the parts are formed of a metal material, so that it is possible not only to prevent damage to the part during the coupling work such as welding, but also to reduce the manufacturing time and manufacturing cost while reducing the defect rate of products.

column12: CLOCK BUFFER IN DELAY LOCKED LOOP
column13: A clock buffer of a delay locked loop(DLL) is provided to secure operation stability of the DLL by preventing abnormal pulsing of a DLL internal clock. A detection part compares a positive external clock with a negative external clock in response to a buffer enable signal. A latch part latches a clock enable signal in response to an output clock of the detection part. A logic assembly part performs logic assembly of the output clock of the detection part and an output signal of the latch part. The latch part comprises a D-flip flop.

column12: TABLE DATA STORAGES FOR TORQUE CONTROL OF POWER SOURCE
column13: The present invention relates to a table data storing medium for torque control of power source. More specifically, the table data storing medium is stored in a hybrid control unit (HCU) which controls an engine control unit (ECU) and a transmission control unit (TCU) and recorded with data in a table structure to control the torque of power source when controlling a transmission. The table comprises a first index part, a second index part, a third index part, a fourth index part, a fifth index part, a sixth index part, and a seventh index part. The table can improve connectivity and accuracy of the torque value in each torque control request section when controlling the torque by using the ECU.

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a semiconductor memory device comprising a delay locked loop outputting a delay-locked clock with a corrected duty ratio irrespective of changes in a voltage, temperature and manufacture state.

SOLUTION: The semiconductor memory device comprises a phase comparator for outputting control signals in accordance with respective phase differences between a reference clock, and a rising and falling feedback clock; a delay line for delaying the reference clock in response to the control signals and outputting the results as a rising delayed clock and a falling delayed clock; a clock transmission part for inverting the rising delayed clock output from the delay line when the rising feedback clock and the falling feedback clock have different phases; a duty compensator for outputting the delay-locked clock with the compensated duty ratio using the rising clock and the falling delayed clock output from the clock transmission part; and a delay model.

column12: REMOVAL DEVICE FOR LIQUID OF REBAR
column13: Disclosed is a removal device for removing liquid formed at a rebar in the process of manufacturing the rebar. The present invention removes liquid from the rebar through specific repetitive movement of a sweep part in contact with the rebar. Meanwhile, the sweet part is formed to simultaneously move by one driving force. Accordingly, liquid formed at a plurality of rebars can be removed at the same time. A removal part re-removes the liquid removed by the sweep part from the sweep part. Therefore, manufacture of defective rebars hardened with liquid formed can be prevented.

column12: Method, apparatus, and system for deciphering media content stream
column13: A method, apparatus and system for media content deciphering is disclosed. In one embodiment, a first content stream is received at a receiver device from a transmitter device coupled to the receiver device, wherein the first content stream having media content formatted in a particular package structure, the media content is associated with High-Definition Content Protection (HDCP) values. The first content stream is deciphered into a second content stream by removing the HDCP values from the first content stream, while the package structure of the media content is maintained.

SEMICONDUCTOR APPARATUS
column13: The present invention comprises: a clock buffer for outputting clock as an internal clock by buffering an external clock in response to an activation control signal; a delay fixed loop for generating a delay fixed clock by comparing phases of the internal clock and a feedback clock; and an operation control unit for generating the activation control signal in accordance with a phase comparison result of the internal clock and the feedback clock in response to a read signal.

column12: Back light apparatus and control method thereof
column13: A back light apparatus includes a back light part which emits light to a liquid crystal display panel, and includes a plurality of LEDs respectively corresponding to a plurality of colors, a detecting part which detects the light emitted from the plurality of the LEDs, a driving part which drives the LEDs to emit, and a controller which controls the driving part to make color ratios substantiallyequal to a reference value if the reference value is not equal to the color ratio between at least two colors among the plurality of colors of the light detected in the detecting part.

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE USING MODULATION CLOCK SIGNAL AND METHOD FOR OPERATING THE SAME
column13: A semiconductor memory device is capable of performing a modulation of output clock signals in order to prevent EMI characteristics of a system having the semiconductor memory device from being degraded. The semiconductor memory device includes a modulation clock signal generator, a clock input unit, a first modulation unit, a delay locked loop circuit, and a second modulation unit. The modulation clock signal generator generates a modulation clock signal. The clock input unit generates a reference clock signal from a system clock signal. The first modulation unit generates a modulated clock signal by modulating the reference clock signal with the modulation clock signal. The delay locked loop circuit performs a delay locking operation on the modulated clock signal to generate a delay locked clock signal. The second modulation unit modulates the delayed locked clock signal with the modulation clock signal.

column12: DELAY LOCKED LOOP CLOCK GENERATION METHOD AND DEVICE FOR LOCKING FAIL STOP
OUTPUT CONTROLLER
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an output controller capable of reducing unnecessary current consumption.

SOLUTION: This controller includes an output enable signal generation means for generating a plurality of output enable signals having information regarding delay time from the activation timing of a read CAS signal and generating only a signal corresponding to set CAS latency, and an output driving signal generation means for outputting the output enable signal corresponding to the CAS latency as an output driving signal for controlling the timing of outputting data to the outside.

column12: A TEST CIRCUIT FOR TESTING A MEMORY DEVICE AND METHODS FOR PERFORMING WRITING AND TESTING IN SUCH DEVICES
Wright signal input buffer in a semiconductor integrated circuit
INTEGRATED CIRCUIT
column13: PURPOSE: An integrated circuit is provided to check a system failure due to a jitter of a system clock and a noise of system power before the integrated circuit is mounted on a system in a test mode. CONSTITUTION: A clock control unit(2) selectively outputs an external clock or a delay clock obtained by delaying the external clock as an input clock in response to a division clock by dividing the external clock in a test mode. An internal circuit(3) operates in response to the input clock. A control signal generating unit outputs the division clock as a control signal in the entry of the test mode. A clock transmitting unit outputs the delay clock as the input clock in response to the control signal in the test mode. [Reference numerals] (1) Power control unit; (2) Clock control unit; (3) Internal circuit

column12: Display apparatus and control method thereof
column13: A display apparatus, includes: a plurality of light emitting elements which emits light of colors respectively; a light sensing part which senses a spectrum emitted from the light emitting elements; adiffusing part which mixes light emitted from the light emitting elements to form a white light; and a control part which plurally changes and outputs predetermined driving values which make the light emitting elements emit light, receives a measured value from a light measuring device which measures the white light formed by the diffusing part whenever the predetermined driving values are changed, calculates tristimulus values out of the received measured value, and calculates a transformation matrix coefficient transformed out of the tristimulus values and a sensing value of the light sensing part.

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR APPARATUS
column13: A DLL clock generation part comprises a delay line generating a DLL clock by retarding the clock with a delay time after the phases of the clock and a feedback clock are compared to determine the delay time of the delay line. A delay detection part enables a delay detection signal when the delay time is a set time by detecting the delay time of the delay line. A power down control part resets the DLL clock generation part when the delay detection signal is disenabled and prevents the DLL clock generation part from being reset in a self refresh operation in the power down mode. [Reference numerals] (110) Buffer;(120) Delay line;(130) Replica;(140) Phase comparison part;(150) Delay control part;(200) Output enable signal generation part;(300) Delay detection part;(400) Power down control part

column12: MONITORING AND SECURITY SYSTEM USING ROBOT
column13: The present invention relates to a system which can monitor a predetermined region and ensure the security thereof by using a robot capable of self-driving and, more specifically, to a monitoring and security system using a robot which can conduct patrol within a management region periodically or when an abnormality occurs and report patrol findings to a user's user terminal located in a remote place, by sending, to a management region, a robot capable of self-driving and of detecting an abnormality such as a sound, smoke, gas, a temperature change, a still object or a moving object. The present invention can be installed and operated by a user himself or herself.

column12: Display apparatus and control method thereof, based on voice commands
column13: A display apparatus and a method of controlling a display apparatus are disclosed. The display apparatus includes: a display configured to display an image based on a video signal; a sound output section configured to output a first sound based on a sound signal; a first sound receiver configured to receive a first mixed sound including the first sound and a second sound of a user; a second sound receiver which is spaced apart at a distance from the first sound receiver and is configured to receive a second mixed sound comprising the first sound and the second sound; and a controller configured to perform control in accordance with the second sound of the user, the second sound being acquired based on the first mixed sound and the second mixed sound.

column12: Process making it possible to write data when testing a memory device, and memory device test circuit
column13: The invention relates to a circuit making it possible to test a memory device, this circuit comprising a data write means M1 to M4, a data monitoring means 3 and a control circuit 1. A process making it possible to write data when testing the memory device comprises the operations consisting in producing a voltage difference between two bit lines B/L, B/L, and in accumulating the datum directly in a capacitor C1 a memory cell 5 [sic]. Direct writing to the bit lines can be carried out according to the invention. Moreover, it is possible to check each memory cell completely in one cycle, so that the test period can be thereby greatly reduced. <IMAGE>

column12: Delay locked loop circuit
column13: A DLL circuit and a synchronous memory device perform stable operation in a power down mode although the entry and exit into/from the power down mode is repeated rapidly. The synchronous memory device operates in a normal mode and a power down mode. A delay locked loop (DLL) generates a DLL clock having frozen locking information when exiting the power down mode. A controller precludes phase update operation of the DLL when a predetermined time passes after entering the power down mode to thereby obtain a time margin for a phase update operation undertaken in the normal mode.

column12: ALKALINE WATER ELECTROLYSIS SYSTEM
column13: An alkaline water electrolysis system includes: a plurality of reaction chambers, each including a main electrode and an auxiliary electrode; a piston provided in each reaction chamber to change a volume of the reaction chamber through reciprocating motion; a drive motor; a connecting rod and a crankshaft installed to change rotational motion of the drive motor into reciprocating linear motion of the piston; a plurality of gas valves installed on an upper side of the reaction chamber to discharge hydrogen and oxygen generated in the reaction chamber through different paths, respectively; a pressure sensor installed in the reaction chamber; a controller configured to open and close the gas valves in response to a signal received from the pressure sensor; and an electrolyte supply apparatus provided to supply an electrolyte to the reaction chambers.
column32: Machine translation of RU2240381. (Year: 2004)

column12: Integrated circuit output buffers having duration sensitive output voltage, and related buffering methods
column13: Integrated circuit output buffers and buffering methods are responsive to the input logic signal frequency to produce higher output voltages for lower frequency logic signals and lower output voltages for higher frequency logic signals. Stated differently, the output level is not raised when the data signal is provided at high speed so that power consumption and noise malfunctions may be reduced. An integrated circuit output buffer includes a driver circuit which is responsive to an input logic signal which is at a first input logic value, to drive an output terminal to a first output logic value. The driver circuit is responsive to the input logic signal at a second logic value which is logically complementary to the first input logic value, to drive the output terminal to a second output logic value at a first voltage level, where the second output logic value is logically complementary to the first output logic value. The integrated circuit buffer also includes a time dependent driver boosting circuit, which is responsive to the input logic signal being at the second input logic value for a predetermined time, to boost the driver circuit to drive the output terminal to the second logic value at a second voltage level which is of greater magnitude than the first voltage level.

column12: DELAY LOCKED LOOP CIRCUIT
Semiconductor memory device and method for operating the same
column13: A semiconductor memory device has a DLL circuit capable of suppressing EMI without distorting a DLL clock required in high-speed operation. The semiconductor memory device includes a delay locked loop (DLL) circuit configured to be responsive to a system clock to output a DLL clock having a phase that is changed when electromagnetic interference (EMI) is detected, for the DLL clock to have frequencies within a delay locking range, and a data output circuit configured to output data in synchronization with the DLL clock.

column13: A method, apparatus and system for media content deciphering is disclosed. The first content stream is deciphered into a second content stream by removing the HDCP values from the first content stream, while the package structure of the media content is maintained.

Delay locked loop circuit
WERKWIJZE EN CIRCUIT VOOR HET TESTEN VAN EEN GEHEUGENINRICHTING.
Delay locked loop circuit with duty cycle correction and method of controlling the same
column13: A delay locked loop block receives external clocks to generate first internal clocks including a reference clock. An internal delay unit delays the first internal clocks to output second internal clocks, which are fed back to the delay locked loop block. The delay locked loop block adjusts delay time of the delay unit according to a phase difference between each second internal clock and the reference clock so that the second internal clocks are delay locked. A duty cycle correcting block corrects a duty cycle of each second internal clock and outputs a duty cycle corrected clock. An error determining unit compares a phase of each second internal clock with one another and, based on the comparison, feeds back a feedback clock including one of the duty cycle corrected clock or the second internal clock to the delay locked loop block.

column12: Delay-locked loop
column13: A semiconductor apparatus includes a DLL clock generation unit configured to compare phases of a clock and a feedback clock, determine a delay time of a delay line, delay the clock by the delay time through the delay line, and generate a DLL clock; a delay detection unit configured to detect the delay time of the delay line and enable a delay detection signal when the delay time is greater than or equal to a predetermined time; and a power-down control unit configured to prevent the DLL clock generation unit from being reset when the delay detection signal is enabled and reset the DLL clock generation unit when the delay detection signal is disabled, in a self-refresh operation under a power-down mode.

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE
column13: A semiconductor memory device is provided to output a delay locked clock signal with proper duty ratio regardless of the variation of voltage, temperature and process, by comprising a delay locked loop. A phase comparison part(400) outputs a control signal in correspondence to phase difference between a reference clock and a feedback rising clock and a feedback falling clock. A delay circuit part outputs a delayed rising clock and a delayed falling clock by delaying the reference clock signal in response to the control signal. A clock transfer part inverts the delayed rising clock outputted from a delay line when the phases of the feedback rising clock and the feedback falling clock signal are not equal. A duty correction part(900) outputs a delay locked clock with corrected duty ratio by using the delayed falling clock and the rising clock outputted from the clock transfer part. A delay model(600) outputs the feedback rising clock and the feedback falling clock by delaying the delay locked clock and the inverted clock outputted from the duty correction part.

column12: Power Generator For Data Line Of Memory Apparatus
column13: The invention provides the power generator includes a bias voltage generator and a voltage clamping circuit. The bias voltage generator receives a reference voltage and generates a bias voltage according to the reference voltage. The voltage clamping circuit is coupled to the bias voltage generator. The voltage clamping circuit receives a supply voltage and the bias voltage and respectively outputs a plurality of data line power to the data transporting buffers by clamping the supply voltage according to the bias voltage. Wherein, the supply voltage is varied between a voltage range, and voltage levels of the data line powers are all constant.

column12: Voltage boosting circuit.
column13: A voltage boosting circuit for boosting a supply voltage VCC supplied from a system to a desired boosting voltage VPP level is described. The voltage boosting circuit includes a transmission transistor 26 formed by a triple-well process. The transmission transistor 26 has bipolar characteristics and operates as a bipolar diode.

The voltage clamping circuit receives a supply voltage and the bias voltage and respectively outputs a plurality of data line power to the data transporting buffers by clamping the supply voltage according to the bias voltage. column12: Delay locked operation in semiconductor memory device
column13: A semiconductor memory device has a control circuit capable of properly controlling a delay locked loop in a variety of operational modes. The semiconductor memory device includes a clock buffer for externally receiving a system clock to output it as an internal clock, a delay locked loop unit for controlling a delay of the internal clock such that a data output timing is synchronized with the system clock; a data output buffer for synchronizing data with the delay locked internal clock, thereby outputting the data, and a clock buffer control unit, responsive to a previous operation state, for generating an enable signal controlling the on/off switching of the clock buffer.

column12: Display apparatus and control method thereof
Apparatuses and methods for line charge sharing
column13: Apparatuses and methods for charge sharing between signal lines are disclosed. An example apparatus may include first and second lines and a charge sharing circuit. The charge sharing circuit may be coupled to the first line and the second line and configured to receive a first data signal and a second data signal. The charge sharing circuit may be further configured to cause charge to be shared between the first line and the second line responsive, at least in part, to the first data signal and the second data signal having different logic levels.

column12: Determining oversampled data to be included in unit intervals
column13: In some embodiments, a chip includes sampling circuitry to produce oversampled data from a received signal, and logic to determine which of the oversampled data are to be part of different unit intervals, wherein some of the unit intervals have a number of oversampled data that is different than a number of oversampled data typically included in the unit intervals. Other embodiments are described and claimed.

column12: Semiconductor apparatus
column13: The present invention discloses a semiconductor apparatus. The semiconductor apparatus includes a DLL clock generation unit configured to compare phases of a clock and a feedback clock, determine a delay time of a delay line, delay the clock by the delay time through the delay line, and generate a DLL clock; a delay detection unit configured to detect the delay time of the delay line and enable a delay detection signal when the delay time is greater than or equal to a predetermined time; and a power-down control unit configured to prevent the DLL clock generation unit from being reset when the delay detection signal is enabled and reset the DLL clock generation unit when the delay detection signal is disabled, in a self-refresh operation under a power-down mode.

column12: AUTOMATIC CHARGING SYSTEM FOR AUTOMATIC GUIDED VEHICLE
column13: The present invention relates to an automatic charging system for an automated guided vehicle, which starts to charge by the operation of a charging switch after positive and negative reception unit and transmission unit electrode terminals of a reception charging unit and a transmission charging unit are connected, not directly when the positive and negative reception unit and transmission unit electrode terminals are connected. The automatic charging system for an automated guided vehicle comprises: a reception charging unit (100) including positive and negative reception unit electrode terminals (110) on the inner side thereof and a grounding unit (130) on a central part of the inner side thereof; a transmission charging unit (200) including positive and negative transmission unit electrode terminals (210) on the outer side thereof to be connected with the positive and negative reception unit electrode terminals (110) of the reception charging unit (100); the charging switch (400) coupled to an insertion unit (240) on the central part of the inner side of the transmission charging unit (200) and guided up and down to enable the automated guide vehicle (10) to be charged; and a limit switch (500) installed on an inner wall of the insertion unit (240) of the transmission charging unit (200) and turned on or off by the guides of the charging switch (400) to control supply of power.

column12: Bus system
column13: A bus system for providing a common data transmission path for N data sources that have M data bits. The N data sources are connected to M interconnections correspondingly through N bus cells each of which includes logic circuits for selectively providing the data bits of data sources into the interconnections. The bus cells are controlled to connect each of the data bits of the data sources to the selected one of the interconnections. The bus system is capable of adapting to delay times or loads of the data sources. The bus system reducing the number and the length of the interconnections.

column12: DELAY LOCKED LOOP AND OPERATION METHOD OF THE SAME
column13: A delay locked loop and an operation method thereof are provided to perform a stable operation in the worst cases noise, PVT(process, voltage, temperature) and frequent entry/exist of a power sown mode are caused in a semiconductor memory device. A delay locking means(400) produces first and second delay clocks(RISING_CLK,FALLING_CLK) which are respectively correspondent to a first and second clock edges(RISING_EDGE, FALLING_EDGE) of a source clock(REF_CLK). A phase detection means(420) outputs a weight selection signal by detecting a phase difference of the first and second delay clocks. A weighted value storage means(430) stores a weight selection signal(WR_SEL) which is obtained during the predetermined section from the first and second delay locking point. A phase blending means(440) outputs a delay locked loop clock(DLL_CLK_USE) by combining the first and second delay clocks.

column12: THE STANDARD ROUTER PLATFORM
DISPLAY APPARATUS AND CONTROL METHOD THEREOF
column13: The present invention relates to a display apparatus and to a control method thereof. The display apparatus includes: a display unit which displays an image based on an image signal; a voice output unit which outputs a first voice based on a voice signal; a first voice receiving unit which receives the first voice and a first synthesis voice of a second voice of a user; a second voice receiving unit which is disposed to be separated from the first voice receiving unit at a specific distance and receives the first voice and a second synthesis voice of the second voice; and a control unit which controls the second voice of the user obtained based on the first synthesis voice and the second synthesis voice. The present invention can remove the voice outputted from the display apparatus of high reliability without cost increase or spatial restriction in respect to the voice recognition of the user.

column12: Display apparatus and control method thereof
METODO PER MEMORIZZARE DATI IN UN TEST DI UN DISPOSITIVO DI MEMORIA E CIRCUITO PER TESTARE UN DISPOSITIVO DI MEMORIA
Parameter scanning for equalisation of over-sampled signals
column13: A method and apparatus for parameter scanning for signal over-sampling. An embodiment of an apparatus includes an equalizer to equalize received data values, and a sampler to over-sample the equalized data. The apparatus includes an eye monitor to generate information regarding quality of signal eyes for the over-sampled data, and an equalization monitor to generate information regarding sufficiency of signal equalization. The apparatus further includes a scan engine to scan possible values of a plurality of parameters for the apparatus.

column12: Testing a memory device
column13: A circuit for testing a memory device has a data writing means (M1 to M4), a data checking means (3), and a control circuit (1). A method for writing data and testing the memory device without using input/output lines (I/O) comprises the steps of generating a voltage difference between a pair of bit lines B/L and B/L using switches (M1 to M4) and a sense amplifier (2), as appropriate, and directly storing the data in a capacitor C1 of a memory cell (5). Each memory cell (5) can be checked by sensing (TQ, M8) the potential at a point H, the latter being influenced by switches (M5, M6) controlled by sensed (2) voltages of the bit lines and by control signals (E, F) from the control circuit (1). <IMAGE>

column12: DELAY LOCKED LOOP CIRCUIT
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a circuit for a stable operation of a delay locked loop circuit in a power down mode operation for a low power operation of a semiconductor with respect to the delay locked loop circuit of SDRAM.

SOLUTION: This circuit is used for preventing locking failure of the delay locked loop (DLL) circuit to be generated in escape of a power-down mode. In this circuit, the phase of an internal clock signal is compared with the phase of a feedback signal to be output from a data output terminal after escape of the power-down mode, and if a time enabling update is short, the internal clock signal is synchronized with the feedback signal, a clock edge of a control signal for informing invasion of the power-down mode is sensed to preventing normal data transmission/reception from becoming difficult, and a clock buffer of the DLL is driven ON/OFF with a signal obtained by delaying the signal.

column12: Filltime control method and system using a power on upshift in vehicle type transmission
column13: 본 발명은 차량의 변속에 따른 파워 온 업시프트 시에 솔레노이드 제어 듀티 옵셋량과 필타임(Filltime)을 재설정할 수 있도록 하는, 차량용 변속기의 파워 온 업시프트 학습을 통한 필 타임 제어 시스템 및 방법이 개시된다. 개시된 파워 온 업시프트 학습을 통한 필 타임 제어 시스템은, 차량의 변속에 따른 파워 온 업시프트(Power on upshift) 또는 다운시프트(Downshift)를 수행하는 차량 변속부; 상기 파워 온 업시프트 또는 다운시프트 시에 관여하는 결합측 솔레노이드와 해방측 솔레노이드를 제어하는 변속 솔레노이드 구동부; 상기 파워 온 업시프트의 변속 발생 시에 솔레노이드 제어 듀티 옵셋(Duty Offset)량을 측정하고 학습하여 듀티 옵셋값으로 누적하여 저장하는 업시프트 학습부; 및 상기 업시프트 학습부를 통해 누적 저장된 듀티 옵셋값이 설정값 이상으로 증가하는 경우에 설정값으로 감소시키고, 감소된 듀티 옵셋값(Y)에 따라 필타임(Filltime) 값을 증가시켜(X) 다음차 동일 변속 시에 적용하도록 상기 변속 솔레노이드 구동부에 재설정하는 필타임 제어부를 포함한다. 본 발명에 의하면, 변속 시에 안전하고 효과적으로 필 유압(Fill Pressure)을 제어할 수 있고, 필 타임(Fill Time)을 조절하여 양호한 변속감을 유지할 수 있다.

column12: CONTROL SYSTEM FOR SUPPLYING HYDROGEN TO FUEL CELL
column13: The present invention relates to a hydrogen supply control system of a fuel cell, comprising: a fuel cell; a hydrogen supply device which receives fuel and supplies gas including hydrogen to the fuel cell; a hydrogen supply line connecting the hydrogen supply device and the fuel cell to supply the gas supplied from the hydrogen supply device to the fuel cell; a compressor located in the hydrogen supply line and compressing the gas supplied from the hydrogen supply device; a bypass line connecting the hydrogen supply device and the fuel cell in parallel with the hydrogen supply line by bypassing the compressor; and a control valve positioned in the bypass line and controlling a flow rate of the gas flowing back along the bypass line by opening and closing and, more specifically, to a hydrogen supply control system of a fuel cell extending a controllable gas flow range.
column14: HYUNDAI MOTOR CO LTD;;KIA MOTORS CORP

column12: Delay locked loop and operating method thereof
column13: A delay locked loop (DLL) includes a delay-locking unit configured to generate first and second delay clocks corresponding to first and second clock edges of a reference clock for achieving a delay-locking; a phase detection unit configured to detect a phase difference between the first and second delay clocks to output a weight selection signal; a weight storage unit configured to store the weight selection signal obtained during a predetermined period from a point of time when the first and second delay clocks are delay locked; and a phase mixing unit configured to mix phases of the first and second delay clocks to output a DLL clock by applying a weight corresponding to the stored weight selection signal in the weight storage unit.

column12: DISPLAY APPARATUS AND CONTROL METHOD THEREOF
column13: A display apparatus, includes: a plurality of light emitting elements which emits light of colors respectively; a light sensing part which senses a spectrum emitted from the light emitting elements; a diffusing part which mixes light emitted from the light emitting elements to form a white light; and a control part which plurally changes and outputs predetermined driving values which make the light emitting elements emit light, receives a measured value from a light measuring device which measures the white light formed by the diffusing part whenever the predetermined driving values are changed, calculates tristimulus values out of the received measured value, and calculates a transformation matrix coefficient transformed out of the tristimulus values and a sensing value of the light sensing part.

column12: TRAILER VEHICLE
column13: PURPOSE: A trailer vehicle is provided to prevent a vehicle from overturning by preventing excessive rotation in a specific angle when rotating through adding crank structure which is not rotated in a specific angle between a tractor and a trailer. CONSTITUTION: A trailer vehicle comprises a trailer(4), a tractor(3), and a connector(5). The trailer loads objects and the tractor pulls the trailer. The connector is connected to a connecting part of the trailer and the tractor and prevents the trailer and the tractor from being bent to greater than 30 degrees.

Back light apparatus and control method thereof
column13: A back light apparatus includes a back light part which emits light to a liquid crystal display panel, and includes a plurality of LEDs respectively corresponding to a plurality of colors, a detecting part which detects the light emitted from the plurality of the LEDs, a driving part which drives the LEDs to emit, and a controller which controls the driving part to make color ratios substantially equal to a reference value if the reference value is not equal to the color ratio between at least two colors among the plurality of colors of the light detected in the detecting part.

column12: Delay locked operation in semiconductor memory device
column13: A semiconductor memory device has a control circuit capable of properly controlling a delay locked loop in a variety of operational modes. The semiconductor memory device includes a clock buffer for externally receiving a system clock to output it as an internal clock, a delay locked loop unit for controlling a delay of the internal clock such that a data output timing is synchronized with the system clock; a data output buffer for synchronizing data with the delay locked internal clock, thereby outputting the data, and a clock buffer control unit, responsive to a previous operation state, for generating an enable signal controlling the on/off switching of the clock buffer.

column12: DISPLAY APPARATUS AND CONTROL METHOD THEREOF
column13: A display apparatus and a control method thereof are provided to calculate transform matrix coefficients based on temperature detected from a temperature detecting part to adjust and correct color coordinates of multi-color light emitting devices. A display apparatus comprises multi-color light emitting devices(122,124,126), a light detecting part(160), a diffusion part(140), a light emitting device part(120), a temperature detecting part(162), and a controlling part(170). The controlling part changes/outputs driving values of driving multi-color light emitting devices, receives measurement values from a light measuring device of measuring the white light, calculates tristimulus values from the measurement values, and calculates transform matrix coefficients based on the temperatures detected from the temperature detecting part. Thereby, color coordinates of the multi-color light emitting devices are adjusted and corrected.

column12: DLL circuit and method of controlling the same
column13: A DLL circuit includes a buffer control unit configured to detect whether or not a DLL power supply exceeds a reference level and output a buffer control signal. A clock buffer buffers an external clock to generate an internal clock when the buffer control signal is enabled.

column12: CONTROL METHOD FOR SUPPLYING HYDROGEN TO FUEL CELL
column13: Introduced is a method for controlling supply of hydrogen to a fuel cell, by controlling a system for supplying hydrogen from a hydrogen supply device to a fuel cell stack, the method comprising: a step of driving a first compressor located in a hydrogen supply line connected to the fuel cell stack from the hydrogen supply device; a step of compressing hydrogen such that a front end pressure or a rear end pressure of the hydrogen supply line satisfies a preset pressure condition as the first compressor is driven; and a step of driving a second compressor connected in parallel to the first compressor through the hydrogen supply line while having an allowable flow rate of an allowable flow rate of the first compressor if the flow rate of hydrogen of the hydrogen supply device increases. Accordingly, a constant pressure of hydrogen can be provided in response to the flow rate of hydrogen.

column12: DELAY LOCKED LOOP AND OPERATING METHOD THEREOF
column13: A delay locked loop (DLL) includes a delay-locking unit configured to generate first and second delay clocks corresponding to first and second clock edges of a reference clock for achieving a delay-locking; a phase detection unit configured to detect a phase difference between the first and second delay clocks to output a weight selection signal; a weight storage unit configured to store the weight selection signal obtained during a predetermined period from a point of time when the first and second delay clocks are delay locked; and a phase mixing unit configured to mix phases of the first and second delay clocks to output a DLL clock by applying a weight corresponding to the stored weight selection signal in the weight storage unit.

column12: DELAY LOCKED CIRCUIT, SEMICONDUCTOR DEVICE, SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE AND OPERATION METHOD THEREOF
column13: A delay locked circuit, a semiconductor device, and a semiconductor memory device and an operating method thereof are provided to enhance operational reliability by reducing electromagnetic interference due to an internal clock of a high frequency used in the semiconductor memory device. A semiconductor memory device includes an input buffer(610), phase detector(620A, 620B), control circuits(650A, 650B), a reproduction delay unit(670A, 670B), and a phase division unit(680A, 680B). The input buffer buffers a system clock. The phase detectors are formed to compare a phase of a reference clock with a phase of a feedback clock and to output the compared result. The delay control circuits are formed to delay phases of internal clocks of the input buffer. The reproduction delay units generate feedback clocks by feeding back outputs of a duty ratio control circuit. The phase division units output delay locked clocks on the basis of the outputs of the duty ratio control circuit..

column12: A WHEEL SPEED SENSING APPARATUS FOR A VEHICLE'S ABS
HEAT PUMP SYSTEM
column13: The present disclosure relates to a heat pump system. The heat pump system removes heat generated during the generation of electric energy using a power generator and also performs heating using waste heat. Since an additional heat source is created in order to meet a heating requirement, heating control is effectively achieved, and electric power is produced so as to meet the demand of electric energy. When the power generator is likely to be over-cooled in the cold season, cooling of the power generator is stably performed by controlling the temperature and the flow rate of a cooling medium moving to the power generator.

column12: LAVER PROCESSOR USING SONICATOR, AND LAVER PROCESSING METHOD USING SONICATOR
column13: To provide a laver processor using a sonicator, and a laver processing method using sonicator.SOLUTION: A laver processor 100 includes: a ship 110 which can float on the sea; a laver processing water tank 120 which is placed in a ship, and where a space into which solution can be charged is provided; a laver moving device 130 which includes a plurality of laver culturing cords 131 to which laver is attached, can move laver culturing cords from one end to the other end of the laver processing water tank; acid solution 140 which is charged into the laver processing water tank; and a sonicator 150 which is connected to the laver processing water tank, and can generate ultrasonic wave in the laver processing water tank. Ultrasonic wave generated by the sonicator is transmitted to acid solution charged into the laver processing water tank via the laver processing water tank, and processes the laver. A laver processing method includes a laver processing water tank arrangement stage, an acid solution dilution stage, an ultrasonic wave generation stage, and a laver processing stage.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1

column12: DOUBLE FLUID INJECTION APPARATUS
column13: The present invention relates to a double fluid injection apparatus which facilitates separating and assembling an injection unit by enabling the injection unit to be separated from a head main body without disassembling a fixing unit fixing the injection unit to the head main body. The double fluid injection apparatus according to the present invention comprises: a housing (100) composed of a housing main body (110) and a sealing block (120); a head unit (210) separating a first fluid and a second fluid respectively from the housing (100) to be supplied, and where an upper part (211), an intermediate part (212), and a lower part (213) are integrally formed; and an injection unit (220) coupled to a coupling unit (215) of the head unit (210) to be separated, and mixing and injecting the first fluid and the second fluid.

column12: APPARATUSES AND METHODS FOR LINE CHARGE SHARING
column13: Apparatuses and methods for charge sharing between signal lines are disclosed. An example apparatus may include first and second lines and a charge sharing circuit, The charge sharing circuit may be coupled to the first line and the second line and configured to receive a first data signal and a second data signal. The charge sharing circuit may be further configured to cause charge to be shared between the first line and the second line responsive, at least in part, to the first data signal and the second data signal having different logic levels.

column12: SEMICODUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE
DETERMINING OVERSAMPLED DATA TO BE INCLUDED IN UNIT INTERVALS
column13: A method for deciding oversampled data to be included in unit intervals is provided to solve a problem that the response speed of a system to a jitter is limited due to that a loop delay occurs from scoring of a logic and selecting a position based on the scoring. A sampling circuit(50) produces oversampled data from a received signal. A logic(52) decides what oversampled data would be a portion of different unit intervals. In this case, some of the unit intervals have a plurality of oversampled data different from a plurality of oversampled data typically included in the unit intervals. Over at least a portion of the decisions, the logic evaluates a section of oversampled data, and looks ahead by evaluating additional oversampled data which follow after the section in the order of time. The oversampled data are arranged in lines, and over a portion of the decisions, the section is positioned at one of the lines and the additional oversampled data is positioned at another one of the lines.

column12: Information leakage mitigation related to elliptic curve operation
column13: Various techniques are provided to achieve information leakage mitigation associated with elliptic curve operations. In one example, a method includes generating second data based on first data. The first data is associated with a message. The second data is associated with the induction message. The method further includes performing a first elliptic curve operation based on the first data. The method further includes performing a second elliptic curve operation based on the second data. The first elliptic curve operation and the second elliptic curve operation are performed in a random order. Related systems and apparatuses are provided.
