METHOD OF SHIFT CONTRILLING ADAPTATION and SHIFTING METHOD
column13: According to the present invention, a power-on downshift shift control learning method comprises: a step of performing correction of a shift preparation section for specific power-on downshift shift operation; a step of measuring an initial rising slope of rpm of a torque converter turbine in the specific power-on downshift shift operation; a step of increasing a base duty when the measured initial rising slope is high and correcting the base duty in a direction of decreasing the base duty when the measured initial rising slope is low; and a step of calculating a control slope according to the corrected shift preparation section and the corrected base duty.

column12: DUST BRUSHING DEVICE FOR VEHICLE
column13: A contaminant removal apparatus for a vehicle is provided to improve the space use by installing plural air nozzles at the front surface of the lower end of the frame. A contaminant removal apparatus for a vehicle comprises a brush frame received/withdrawn to the inner and outer sides by the drive of a first motor; a brush(13) rotatably supported on the brush frame and rotated by the drive of a second motor to brush the contaminant such as dust attached at the shoes; an ECU(14,Electronic Control Unit) receiving the switch signal and controlling the drive of the first and second motors; and a case having a door whose front surface is opened/closed to receive the brush frame and the brush. The brush frame is connected by a tube to the side of a compressor(20) controlled by the ECU and mounted at the front surface of the lower end of the frame to inject the air.

column12: OUTPUT CONTROL DEVICE
METHOD FOR CONTORLLING OIL PRESSURE OF TRASMISSION
column13: The present invention relates to a method for controlling oil pressure of a transmission and, more specifically, relates to a method for controlling oil pressure of a transmission in an EOP-less idle stop and go (ISG) mode. According to the present invention, the method for controlling oil pressure of a transmission comprises the following steps of: checking a learning condition; checking whether an acceleration pedal is operated; performing time learning when the acceleration pedal is not operated, and storing a learning amount; performing turbine speed change amount learning when the acceleration pedal is operated, and storing a leaning amount; and applying the learning amount to be applied to the same following shifting.

The display apparatus includes: a display configured to display an image based on a video signal; a sound output section configured to output a first sound based on a sound signal; a first sound receiver configured to receive a first mixed sound including the first sound and a second sound of a user; a second sound receiver which is spaced apart at a distance from the first sound receiver and is configured to receive a second mixed sound comprising the first sound and the second sound; and a controller configured to perform control in accordance with the second sound of the user, the second sound being acquired based on the first mixed sound and the second mixed sound.

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR DEVICE MANUFACTURING APPARATUS
column13: A semiconductor device manufacturing apparatus is provided to prevent an increase of undesired power within a process chamber and elongate PM(Preventive Maintenance) cycle, since HCL gas jetted from a gas jetting nozzle prevents a pyrometer measuring temperature within a process chamber from being coated by a thermal oxide. A semiconductor device manufacturing apparatus comprises a substrate loading unit(200), a process chamber(202), a heating unit(204), a heat reflection unit(206), a reflection angle adjustment unit(208), a process gas injection unit(210), a gas exhaust unit(212), first and second pyrometers(214a,214b) and a gas jetting nozzle(216). The substrate loading unit is where a semiconductor substrate to be processed by thermal oxidation. The process chamber comprises an upper chamber(202a) isolating the substrate loading unit from outside, and a lower chamber(202b). The heating unit is respectively installed on upper and lower sides of the process chamber. The heat reflection unit reflects heat generated from the heating unit to the substrate loading unit. The reflection angle adjustment unit adjusts angle of a reflection panel of the heat reflection unit. The process gas injection unit, which is installed on one side of the process chamber, is where process gas is injected into the process chamber for the thermal oxidation process. The gas exhaust unit, which is formed on a corresponding position of the process gas injection unit, exhausts unnecessary gas within the process chamber. The first and second pyrometers are respectively installed on the upper and lower chambers of the process chamber, to measure temperature within the process chamber. The gas jetting nozzle is formed to reach the second pyrometer on the lower chamber. The HCL gas is jetted through the gas jetting nozzle.

column12: Nonvolatile memory device for performing duty correction operation, memory system, and operating method thereof
column13: A nonvolatile memory device suitable for sequentially performing a ZQ calibration operation and a read operation in response to a ZQ calibration enable signal and a read enable signal. The nonvolatile memory device includes a duty ratio control block suitable for receiving the read enable signal, performing a duty correction operation and setting a duty ratio, in a ZQ calibration operation period, and receiving the read enable signal and outputting a duty-corrected clock based on the set duty ratio, in a read operation period; a clock generation block suitable for generating an internal clock signal in response to the duty-corrected clock; and a data output block suitable for outputting data outputted from an internal memory cell region, in synchronization with the internal clock signal.

The electronic device for providing content comprises: a sensing unit which senses a moving state or a holding state of the electronic device; and a controlling unit which stops supplying the content if the electronic device is changed into the moving state from the holding state while supplying the content in the holding state, and supplies the content if the electronic device is changed from the moving state into the holding state.

column12: Generate multiple product single code and management method for Generate and manage product-specific codes in a single code
column13: The present invention relates to a composite product market generation and management method of using individual product codes to generate and manage composite product codes and, more specifically, to a composite product market generation and management method of using individual product codes to generate and manage composite product codes which generates and manages a single code for a single composite product from codes of composite products selected by a seller to combine various products differentiated from other sellers for each product sold at an online market or an offline market to sell composite products in a personalized concept.

column12: Business to business autobridge system
column13: The present invention relates to a business to business (B2B) auto-bridge system. In particular, images and Excel files (option, template, etc.) required when sellers register goods to an online open market (Gmarket, Auction, 11st, Wemakeprice, TMON, etc.) are automatically extracted without Photoshop and Excel works to generate a goods drawer in real-time so as to store and manage the goods drawer, and the goods drawer is automatically uploaded to an open market appointed by the seller to perform sales. Inconvenience, which is a problem of existing goods drawers, to provide a goods drawer for each single goods is solved to provide a goods list. When a plurality of predetermined goods are selected from the goods list, a profit rate of corresponding goods, a name of an open market where the goods are sold, and a fee rate fixated in the open market are inputted, a profit rate is automatically calculated, thereby allowing the sellers to check profit at a glance. According to the present invention, the system comprises an open market goods drawer management server and a user terminal.

column12: Method, apparatus and system for deciphering media content stream
column13: A method, apparatus and system for pre-authenticating ports is disclosed. In one embodiment, an active port facilitating communication of media content between a transmitting device and a receiving device is identified, while the active port are associated with a first High-Definition Content Protection (HDCP) engine. Then, inactive ports that are in idle mode serving as backup ports to the active port are identified, while the inactive ports are associated with a second HDCP engine. Pre-authentication of each of the inactive ports is performed so the pre-authenticated inactive ports can subsequently replace the active port if a port switch is performed.

column12: BACK LIGHT APPARATUS AND CONTROL METHOD THEREOF
column13: A backlight unit and a method of controlling the backlight unit are provided to control only LEDs(Light Emitting Diodes) in some of colors among a plurality of color LEDs to facilitate color control and easily adjust brightness while maintaining color coordinates. A backlight unit includes a backlight(200), a driver(300), and a controller(400). The backlight irradiates light to an LCD(Liquid Crystal Display) panel(100) and includes a plurality of color LEDs. The driver drives the plurality of LEDs to emit lights. The controller controls the driver so that the ratio of at least two colors among lights colors emitted from the plurality of LEDs becomes a predetermined value.

column12: LED SIGN IN WHICH THE LEDS EMIT LIGHT AT AN ANGLE AND INSTALLATION METHOD THEREOF
column13: PURPOSE: A diagonal line type light emitting diode-based sign board is provided to expand an effective recognition distance by controlling the installing angle of the main light direction from light emitting diodes. CONSTITUTION: A light emitting diode slit(10) includes a cylindrical type vertical rotary shaft(11) which is protruded to both end parts of the light emitting diode slit. A frame(20) includes one or more light emitting diode slits. The frame includes holes in which the vertical rotary shaft is contained. A plurality of light emitting diode slits is constantly arranged in the frame. A plurality of concavo-convex parts(121) is arranged on the external surface of a cylindrical rotating body(12).

column12: Semiconductor device
column13: A semiconductor device may include a delay line including a first group of unit delay cells and a second group of unit delay cells. The first group of unit delay cells and the second group of unit delay cells may be configured for delaying a phase of a clock by a unit cycle of a reference frequency. The reference frequency may serve as a reference for distinguishing between a first frequency and a second frequency. The semiconductor device may include a reservoir capacitor located adjacent to one or more of the unit delay cells of the first group. Only the first group of the unit delay cells may be used to delay the phase of the clock.

column13: A method and apparatus for parameter scanning for signal over-sampling. An embodiment of an apparatus includes an equalizer to equalize received data values, and a sampler to over-sample the equalized data. The apparatus includes an eye monitor to generate information regarding quality of signal eyes for the over-sampled data, and an equalization monitor to generate information regarding sufficiency of signal equalization. The apparatus further includes a scan engine to scan possible values of a plurality of parameters for the apparatus.

column12: REAL PROPERTY MANAGEMENT SYSTEM AND THE METHOD THEREOF IN COMMUNICATION NETWORK
column13: PURPOSE: A system and a method for managing real estate property using communication network are provided to execute as proxy in tasks managing asset related to real estate, thereby conveniently managing real estate of both an owner and a user. CONSTITUTION: A facilities manager(120) provides service managing real estate facility through the internet. A leasing manager(130) act as substitute for a lessor according to rental contract of real estate. The lease administration part offers rental management task agency service. A billing manager(140) acts as a proxy in processing administrative expense of real estate.

column12: Parameter scanning for signal over-sampling
column13: A method and apparatus for parameter scanning for signal over sampling. An embodiment of an apparatus includes an equalizer to equalize received data values, and a sampler to over sample the equalized data. The apparatus includes an eye monitor to generate information regarding quality of signal eyes for the over sampled data, and an equalization monitor to generate information regarding sufficiency of signal equalization. The apparatus further includes a scan engine to scan possible values of a plurality of parameters for the apparatus.

column12: Display apparatus and control method thereof
column13: A display apparatus and a method of controlling a display apparatus are disclosed. The display apparatus includes: a display configured to display an image based on a video signal; a sound output section configured to output a first sound based on a sound signal; a first sound receiver configured to receive a first mixed sound including the first sound and a second sound of a user; a second sound receiver which is spaced apart at a distance from the first sound receiver and is configured to receive a second mixed sound comprising the first sound and the second sound; and a controller configured to perform control in accordance with the second sound of the user, the second sound being acquired based on the first mixed sound and the second mixed sound.

column12: Delay locked loop circuit and method for provding delay locked loop clock of synchronous memory device
column13: A synchronous memory device having a normal mode and a power down mode includes a power down mode controller for generating a power down mode control signal in response to a clock enable signal, thereby determining onset or termination of a power down mode. A clock buffering unit buffers an external clock signal in response to the power down mode control signal and outputs first and second internal clock signals. A clock selection unit selects one of the first and second internal clock signals based on the power down mode control signal to output the selected signal as an intermediate output clock signal. A phase update unit performs a phase update operation by using the intermediate output clock signal to output a delay locked loop (DLL) clock signal, the first internal clock signal differing in frequency from the second internal clock signal.

column12: Method for writing data in testing memory device and circuit for testing memory device
column13: A circuit for testing a memory device includes a data writing circuit, a data checking circuit, and a control circuit. A method for writing data in testing the memory device comprises the steps of generating a voltage difference between a pair of bit lines B/L and B/L, and storing directly data corresponding to the voltage difference in a capacitor of a memory cell. Direct writing of data on the bit lines is performed. Moreover, each memory cell is totally checked during one cycle, and the test time is greatly reduced.

column12: OWC Method and apparatus for controlling oil pressure of OWC-adapted automatic transmission
column13: 본 발명은 OWC가 적용된 자동변속기에서 변속 수행시 결합측 솔레노이드의 편차에 의한 변속준비 유압의 과다로 인한 문제 발생시 기존 로직들의 약점을 보완하며 선제적으로 하드웨어를 보호하고 변속감을 확보할 수 있는 기술이다. 본 발명에 따르면, 변속기 제어기는 변속준비구간의 시간계측값과 변속 타겟시간 간의 차이로부터 보상로직 적용 여부를 결정한다. 보상로직 적용 결정 후 보상값인 유압 옵셋 및 기울기의 적용량을 결정하고, 보상값 적용 시점을 결정한다. 보상은 실변속 구간에서 솔레노이드 제어시에 적용한다. 보상 옵셋과 보상 기울기는 맵으로 구성되며, 이 맵은 상기 시간 차이값과 터빈토크를 기준으로 구성된다. 상기 보상 옵셋과 보상 기울기의 적용 시점은 실변속 구간 시작 후 사전 정의된 시간 이후로 조절될 수 있다.

column12: Register controlled delay locked loop circuit
column13: A register controlled delay locked loop (DLL) circuit, including: a phase comparator configured to compare phases of a source clock and a feedback clock with each other, and a clock delay circuit configured to delay a phase of an internal clock synchronized with a clock edge of the source clock in response to an output signal of the phase comparator. The clock delay circuit delays the phase of the internal clock using first delay units for a predetermined delay duration, and thereafter delays the phase of the internal clock using second delay units, the second delay unit providing a longer delay than the first delay unit. A delay replica model is configured to reflect actual delay conditions of the source clock in an output clock of the clock delay circuit to output the feedback clock.
column32: Notice of Allowance issued from Korean Intellectual Property Office on Aug. 26, 2009 with an English Translation.

column12: METHOD OF REDUCING CURRENT CONSUMPTION OF ELECTRIC HYDRAULIC POWER STEERING SYSTEM FOR VEHICLE
column13: A method of reducing current consumption of an electric hydraulic power steering system for a vehicle includes determining whether or not a steering wheel is manipulated after an engine is started, and activating a sleep mode if it is determined that the steering wheel is not manipulated and if a vehicle speed is lower than a reference value for activating the sleep mode, or if it is determined that the steering wheel is manipulated and if an amount of current conducted in a motor, a vehicle speed and a steering angular velocity are lower than respective reference values for a predetermined time. According to the method, it is possible to reduce current consumption when the steering wheel is not manipulated and improve the vehicular fuel efficiency.

column12: Output timing control circuit and semiconductor apparatus using the same
column13: An output timing control circuit of a semiconductor apparatus includes a delay amount counter block configured to count a delay amount of an output reset pulse signal based on an external clock signal and output a first counting code, wherein the delay amount counter block is configured to control the delay amount of the output reset pulse signal depending upon a frequency of the external clock signal; an operation block configured to subtract a code value of the first counting code from a code value of a data output delay code, and output a delay control code; and a phase control block configured to control a phase of a read command signal by the number of clocks of a DLL clock signal corresponding to a code value of the delay control code, and output an output enable flag signal.

column12: Delay locked operation in semiconductor memory device
column13: A semiconductor memory device has a control circuit capable of properly controlling a delay locked loop in a variety of operational modes. The semiconductor memory device includes a clock buffer for externally receiving a system clock to output it as an internal clock, a delay locked loop unit for controlling a delay of the internal clock such that a data output timing is synchronized with the system clock; a data output buffer for synchronizing data with the delay locked internal clock, thereby outputting the data, and a clock buffer control unit, responsive to a previous operation state, for generating an enable signal controlling the on/off switching of the clock buffer.
column32: Korean Office Action issued in Korean Patent Application No. KR 2006-0049114 dated Jun. 18, 2007.;;Korean Office Action issued in Korean Patent Application No. KR 2006-0049114 dated Feb. 4, 2008.;;Office Action Issued by the Taiwanese Patent Office on Mar. 31, 2009, with an English Translation.

column12: Alkaline water electrolysis system
column13: An alkaline water electrolysis system includes: a plurality of reaction chambers, each including a main electrode and an auxiliary electrode; a piston provided in each reaction chamber to change a volume of the reaction chamber through reciprocating motion; a drive motor; a connecting rod and a crankshaft installed to change rotational motion of the drive motor into reciprocating linear motion of the piston; a plurality of gas valves installed on an upper side of the reaction chamber to discharge hydrogen and oxygen generated in the reaction chamber through different paths, respectively; a pressure sensor installed in the reaction chamber; a controller configured to open and close the gas valves in response to a signal received from the pressure sensor; and an electrolyte supply apparatus provided to supply an electrolyte to the reaction chambers.
column32: Machine translation of RU2240381. (Year: 2004).

column12: DELAY-LOCKED LOOP
column13: A semiconductor apparatus includes a DLL clock generation unit configured to compare phases of a clock and a feedback clock, determine a delay time of a delay line, delay the clock by the delay time through the delay line, and generate a DLL clock; a delay detection unit configured to detect the delay time of the delay line and enable a delay detection signal when the delay time is greater than or equal to a predetermined time; and a power-down control unit configured to prevent the DLL clock generation unit from being reset when the delay detection signal is enabled and reset the DLL clock generation unit when the delay detection signal is disabled, in a self-refresh operation under a power-down mode.

column12: Semiconductor memory device and method for operating the same
column13: A semiconductor memory device has a DLL circuit capable of suppressing EMI without distorting a DLL clock required in high-speed operation. The semiconductor memory device includes a delay locked loop (DLL) circuit configured to be responsive to a system clock to output a DLL clock having a phase that is changed when electromagnetic interference (EMI) is detected, for the DLL clock to have frequencies within a delay locking range, and a data output circuit configured to output data in synchronization with the DLL clock.

column12: Spannungserhöhungsschaltung
Circuit for stabilizing a reference voltage
column13: A circuit for stabilizing a potential difference between a supply voltage terminal (Vcc) and ground (Vss), comprises diodes (D1, D2) connected between the supply voltage terminal and ground, a reference voltage output (OUT) being taken from that terminal of the diodes which is the further from ground. The diodes are connected to ground through a bias-adjusting MOS transistor (M3) providing a variable-resistance path. A negative feedback loop (1) controls the resistance of the transistor (M3) to stabilise the reference voltage level. The circuit is useful with a semiconductor memory device, in which case the negative feedback loop (1) comprises MOS transistors acting as voltage dividing resistances (M1, M2). <IMAGE>

column12: APPARATUS AND METHOD FOR COMPENSATING HYDRAULIC DEFLECTION OF AUTO TRANSMISSION
column13: The present invention relates to an apparatus for correcting a hydraulic deviation of an automatic transmission, and a method therefor. The apparatus for correcting a hydraulic deviation of an automatic transmission comprises: a sensing unit sensing the rotational speed of a turbine of the automatic transmission after gear-shifting is started; a time counting unit counting time consumed for changing the sensed rotational speed of the turbine to be less than the preset critical speed; a comparison unit comparing the counted time with preset target time; and a hydraulic pressure correction unit controlling the correction of hydraulic pressure of a hydraulic solenoid in accordance with a result of the comparison.

column12: SYSTEM FOR MUSEUM OR EXHIBITION CENTER BY USING A ROBOT DOCENT
column13: PURPOSE: A robot exhibition guide system is provided to enable a total exhibit system to bring a service for spectators by processing movement of robot and multimedia service content at one storyline. CONSTITUTION: A docent robot(40) freely travels an obstacle according to a moving path by using distance information with a neighboring object sensed by location information in real time which a location measurement system provides, encoder information of a robot itself, and a sensor unit. Based on location information inside exhibition, a robot control station(20) provides functions for setting moving path of docent robot, guiding points necessary for guiding service, and functions setting the multimedia information.

column12: NONVOLATILE MEMORY DEVICE MEMORY SYSTEM AND OPERATING METHOD THEREOF
column13: The present invention relates to a non-volatile memory device, a memory system and a method for operating the same, and the memory system includes a memory controller and a non-volatile memory device performing a specific operation in response to a command input from the memory controller. The non-volatile memory device sequentially performs a ZQ calibration operation and a read operation in response to a ZQ calibration-enable signal and a read-enable signal input from the memory controller. In the ZQ calibration operation, the memory controller outputs the read-enable signal to the non-volatile memory device, and the non-volatile memory device sets a duty ratio by performing a duty calibration operation in response to the read-enable signal. In the read operation, the non-volatile memory device generates an internal clock signal based on the set duty ratio, synchronizes data with the internal clock signal and outputs the data. The non-volatile memory device according to the present invention performs a duty calibration operation using a ZQ calibration operation that has been performed for impedance matching of signal lines between memory controllers, so that data may be transmitted at high reliability using a minimum area.

column12: INTEGRATED CIRCUIT
column13: An integrated circuit includes a clock control unit configured to selectively output an external clock or a delayed clock acquired by delaying the external clock as an input clock in response to a divided clock generated by dividing the external clock, when a test mode is entered; and an internal circuit operating in response to the input clock.

column12: FURNACE FOR PROCESSING A SEMICONDUCTOR WAFER
DLL circuit and delay-locked method using the same
column13: A delay-locked loop (DLL) circuit having improved phase correction performance includes a variable delay unit configured to generate a DLL clock signal by delaying an input clock signal by a varied delay time in response to a delay control signal at timing corresponding to an update cycle signal, a delay model configured to generate a feedback clock signal by delaying the DLL clock signal for a predetermined delay time, a phase detection unit configured to output a result of the detection of the phase of the feedback clock signal based on a reference clock signal as the delay control signal, and an update cycle control unit configured to determine whether a cycle has been shifted or not in response to an external clock signal and the delay control signal and shift a cycle where the update cycle signal is generated based on a result of the determination.

column12: Voltage boosting circuit of a semiconductor memory device
SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR CONTROLLING MODE OF TRANSMISSION
column13: PURPOSE: A transmission mode control system and a control method thereof are provided to detect the load variation of a vehicle by measuring the pressure of a tire. CONSTITUTION: A TPMS(Tire Pressure Monitoring System)(10) measures the pressure of a tire and delivers measured data to a transmission mode control system(100). A transmission system(20) comprises a transmission control unit(21) and a transmission(22). The transmission control unit controls the transmission to operate in a speed changing mode selected by the speed changing mode control system. [Reference numerals] (100) Transmission mode control system; (20) Transmission system; (22) Transmission

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY APPARATUS
column13: A semiconductor memory apparatus may include a clock buffer configured to receive an external clock signal, buffer the external clock signal in response to an activation control signal, and the clock buffer configured to output an internal clock signal in response to an activation control signal. The semiconductor memory apparatus may also include a delay-locked loop block configured to receive the internal clock signal outputted from the clock buffer and compare phases of the internal clock signal and a feedback clock signal, and responsively generate a delay-locked clock signal. The semiconductor memory apparatus may also include an operation control block configured to responsively generate the activation control signal which is received by the clock buffer in accordance with a result of comparing the phases of the internal clock signal and the feedback clock signal, in response to receiving a read signal.

column13: A synchronous memory device having a normal mode and a power down mode includes a power down mode controller for generating a power down mode control signal in response to a clock enable signal, thereby determining onset or termination of a power down mode. A clock buffering unit buffers an external clock signal in response to the power down mode control signal and outputs first and second internal clock signals. A clock selection unit selects one of the first and second internal clock signals based on the power down mode control signal to output the selected signal as an intermediate output clock signal. A phase update unit performs a phase update operation by using the intermediate output clock signal to output a delay locked loop (DLL) clock signal, the first internal clock signal differing in frequency from the second internal clock signal.

According to the method, it is possible to reduce current consumption when the steering wheel is not manipulated and improve the vehicular fuel efficiency.

column12: Heat reflector and substrate processing apparatus comprising the same
column13: A substrate processing apparatus includes a process chamber including upper and lower quartz walls, a substrate support disposed in the process chamber, radiant heaters respectively provided above and below the quartz walls of the chamber, and heat reflectors disposed outside the process chamber for reflecting heat towards the substrate support. Each of the heat reflectors has heating has a first thermally reflective section oriented to reflect the heat towards an outer peripheral region of the substrate support and a second thermally reflective section oriented to reflect the heat towards a central region of the substrate support. Each heat reflector also has a reflection angle adjusting mechanism by which an angle at which the second thermally reflective section reflects heat can be adjusted. The angle is adjusted depending on the temperature distribution across the substrate so that the substrate can be processed uniformly.

METHOD, APPARATUS AND SYSTEM FOR DECIPHERING MEDIA CONTENT STREAM
column13: A method, apparatus and system for pre-authenticating ports is disclosed. In one embodiment, an active port facilitating communication of media content between a transmitting device and a receiving device is identified, while the active port are associated with a first High-Definition Content Protection (HDCP) engine. Then, inactive ports that are in idle mode serving as backup ports to the active port are identified, while the inactive ports are associated with a second HDCP engine. Pre-authentication of each of the inactive ports is performed so the pre-authenticated inactive ports can subsequently replace the active port if a port switch is performed.

column12: RFID TAG WITH THE HIGH ENDURANCE
column13: The present invention relates to a highly-durable RFID tag using chip module packaging capable of: enhancing durability of the tag by removing causes for short circuits between an RFID tag chip and an antenna frequently happening in RFID tag manufacturing and use environments by electrically separating a resonance circuit in which the RFID tag chip is attached and a dielectric antenna which supplies power; and enhancing productivity by significantly reducing costs for bonding of the RFID tag chip which account for the most of the manufacturing costs of the RFID tag. To that end, the present invention includes: an RFID tag chip module (1) which is formed by wire-bonding an RFID tag chip (11) to a micro-sized printed circuit board (13) on which a resonance circuit (14) is printed and performing epoxy-molding; and a label tag which is formed by packaging the RFID tag chip module (1) to the central part of an antenna dielectric (3) while not being electrically connected directly to the antenna dielectric using an adhesive or silicon.

column12: Semiconductor apparatus
column13: A semiconductor apparatus for reducing unnecessary current consumption disclosed. The semiconductor apparatus includes: a clock signal transmission unit that selectively transmits a clock signal in accordance with the frequency of the clock signal at an operation standby mode. A delay locked loop generates a DLL clock signal on the basis of the clock signal inputted through the clock signal transmission unit. The delay locked loop generates the DLL clock signal during a period where the clock signal is transmitted.

column12: PARAMETER SCANNING FOR SIGNAL OVER-SAMPLING
column13: A parameter scanning for signal oversampling is provided to prevent degradation of display quality of audio-visual data caused by degraded signal quality. An equalizer(315) equalizes received data values. A sampler(320) oversamples the equalized data. An eye monitor(340) generates information about quality of signal eyes with respect to the oversampled data. An equalizing monitor generates information about sufficiency of signal equalization. A scan engine(345) scans possible values of a plurality of parameters with respect to a device. The scanning of the parameters includes adjusting the parameters based on received signal quality information and evaluating the parameters, and the received signal quality information includes information about the sufficiency of signal equalization and the information about the signal eyes with respect to the oversampled data from the eye monitor.

column12: Output controller capable of generating only necessary control signals based on an activated selection signal
column13: An output controller includes: an output enable signal generator for generating corresponding ones among a plurality of output enable signals based on a preset column address strobe (CAS) latency, each of the output enable signals having information relating to a delay time from an activation timing of a CAS signal; and an output driving signal generator for receiving the plurality of output enable signals corresponding to the preset CAS latency and outputting rising and falling output driving signals for controlling an output timing of data.

column12: SPRAY-NOZZLE HOUSING AND TWO-FLUID SPRAYING DEVICE USING SAME
column13: Disclosed is an invention concerning a spray-nozzle housing and a two-fluid spraying device using same. The two-fluid spraying device using the spray-nozzle housing which is disclosed comprises: a housing forming two partitioned fluid inflow spaces; a first cover part which is connected to the housing in such a way as to supply fluid to one of the fluid inflow spaces, and which covers one of the fluid inflow spaces; a second cover part which is connected to the housing in such a way as to supply fluid to the other of the fluid inflow spaces, and which covers the other of the fluid inflow spaces; and spray nozzles which are connected to the housing while forming flow pathways respectively connecting through to the fluid inflow spaces, and which simultaneously spray different fluids through each of the flow pathways.

column12: HOUSING FOR INJECTING NOZZLE AND SPRAY DEVICE USING THE SAME
column13: Disclosed are a housing for an injection nozzle and a device for injecting two fluids by using the same. The device for injecting two fluids by using the housing for an injection nozzle includes a first cover unit covering one of fluid inflow space units by being connected to the housing in order to supply a fluid to one of the fluid inflow space units and the housing having two divided fluid inflow space units; a second cover unit covering the other fluid inflow space by being connected to the housing in order to supply the fluid to the other fluid inflow space unit; and an injection nozzle which is connected to the housing by having a fluid path individually connected to the fluid inflow space unit and injects the different fluids through each fluid path.

column12: Delay locked loop circuit and semiconductor memory device using the same
column13: The present invention relates to a delay locked loop (DLL) circuit. The DLL circuit includes a phase comparator configured to compare a phase of a source clock with a phase of a feedback clock and generate a delay locking signal based on the comparison result, a clock delay configured to delay the source clock in response to the delay locking signal for locking delay, output the delayed source clock as a delay locked clock, and generate a delay end signal when a delay amount has reached a delay limit, a delay replica model configured to reflect a delay time of an output path of the source clock at the delay locked clock and output the reflected clock as the feedback clock, and a delay locking operation controller configured to terminate a delay locking operation in response to the delay locking signal and the delay end signal.
column32: Notice of Preliminary Rejection issued from Korean Intellectual Property Office on Dec. 22, 2010.

column12: INFORMATION LEAKAGE MITIGATION ASSOCIATED WITH ELLIPTIC CURVE OPERATIONS
column13: Various techniques are provided to implement information leakage mitigation associated with elliptic curve operations. In one example, a method includes generating second data based on first data. The first data is associated with a message. The second data is associated with a decoy message. The method further includes performing a first elliptic curve operation based on the first data. The method further includes performing a second elliptic curve operation based on the second data. The first elliptic curve operation and the second elliptic curve operation are performed in a random order. Related systems and devices are provided.

column12: Semiconductor memory device using modulation clock signal and method for operating the same
column13: A semiconductor memory device is capable of performing a modulation of output clock signals in order to prevent EMI characteristics of a system having the semiconductor memory device from being degraded. The semiconductor memory device includes a modulation clock signal generator, a clock input unit, a first modulation unit, a delay locked loop circuit, and a second modulation unit. The modulation clock signal generator generates a modulation clock signal. The clock input unit generates a reference clock signal from a system clock signal. The first modulation unit generates a modulated clock signal by modulating the reference clock signal with the modulation clock signal. The delay locked loop circuit performs a delay locking operation on the modulated clock signal to generate a delay locked clock signal. The second modulation unit modulates the delayed locked clock signal with the modulation clock signal.
column32: Foreign Office Action issued from Korean Intellectual Property Office on May 21, 2008 with an English translation.

column12: DELAY LOCKED LOOP
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a delay locked loop which can stably operate even under the worst condition of a semiconductor memory device such as noise interference, PVT variation and frequent entry/exit of a power down mode.

SOLUTION: The delay locked loop includes a delay-locking unit which generates a first delay clock and a second delay clock corresponding to a first clock edge and a second clock edge of a source clock, a phase detection unit which detects a phase difference between the first delay clock and the second delay clock to output a weighted value selection signal, a weighted value storage unit which stores the weighted value selection signal obtained during a predetermined period from a point of time when the first delay clock and the second delay clock are delay-locked and a phase mixing unit which mixes the phase of the first delay clock with the phase of the second delay clock to output a delay-locked loop clock.

column12: DETERMINING OVERSAMPLED DATA TO BE INCLUDED IN UNIT INTERVALS
column13: In some embodiments, a chip includes sampling circuitry to produce oversampled data from a received signal, and logic to determine which of the oversampled data are to be part of different unit intervals, wherein some of the unit intervals have a number of oversampled data that is different than a number of oversampled data typically included in the unit intervals. Other embodiments are described and claimed.

column12: DELAY LOCKED LOOP CIRCUIT AND SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE USING THE SAME
column13: PURPOSE: A delay locked loop circuit and a semiconductor memory device using the same are provided to prevent infinitely repeat a resistor control type delay locked operation by regulating the voltage level of a power voltage supplied to the resistor control type delay locked circuit. CONSTITUTION: A clock buffering part(280) buffers clocks(CLK, CLK#) applied from the outside. A source clock driving part(260) drives the output clock of the clock buffering part(BUF_CLK) and outputs the output clock as a source clock(REFCLK). A phase comparing part(200) generates a delay locked signal(DELAY_LOCK_CTRL). A clock delaying part(220) generates a delay ending signal(DELAY_END_CTRL). A delay locked operation controlling part(250) terminates a delay locked operation.

column12: Determining oversampled data to be included in unit intervals
column13: In some embodiments, a chip includes sampling circuitry to produce oversampled data from a received signal, and logic to determine which of the oversampled data are to be part of different unit internals, wherein some of the unit intervals have a number of oversampled data that is different that a number of oversampled data typically included in the unit intervals. Other embodiments are described and claimed.

column12: Redundancy circuits for integrated circuit memory devices including repair controlling circuits and enable controlling circuits
column13: Integrated circuit memory device redundancy circuits include a plurality of field effect transistors and fuses, a respective field effect transistor and a respective fuse being serially coupled between a respective address line and a logic circuit to generate a selection signal for a redundant memory cell in response to a predetermined address on the address lines. A pump-up circuit generates a pump-up voltage from a power supply voltage, wherein the pump-up voltage is greater than the power supply voltage. The pump-up voltage is applied to the gates of the field effect transistors to activate the redundancy circuit. According to another aspect, a redundancy circuit for an integrated circuit memory device comprises a repair controlling circuit that includes a repair fuse and that generates a repair control signal in response to opening of the repair control fuse. The enable controlling circuit is responsive to the repair controlling circuit and includes an enable fuse to generate a redundant enable signal in response to the repair control signal and opening of the enable fuse. A redundancy signal generator is responsive to the enable controlling circuit to generate a selection signal for a redundant memory cell in response to receipt of an address of a defective memory cell.

column12: DISK ROTE FOR AUTOMOBILE
column13: A disc rotor of vehicle is provided to prevent the abnormal vibration(Judder) since the disc rotor is deformed. A disc rotor(16) of vehicle comprises a central part(16a) screwed up on herb, a neck part which is extended to the outer side from the central part and the step height A-frame is curve-cut, an undercut part(16c) extended to the outer side from the neck part, an internal disk part(16d) contacted with the pad within caliper in the brake, an external disk part(16h) which the internal disk part and opposing A-frame is arranged.

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE AND OPERATING METHOD THEREOF
column13: The present invention relates to an electronic device, and more particularly, to a semiconductor memory device and a method of operating the same. The semiconductor memory device capable of detecting failure in a specific region within a peripheral circuit according to the present invention includes a memory cell array including a plurality of memory cells, a peripheral circuit having a partial region located in the lower part of the memory cell array and controlling the memory cell array, and a fail detection part which detects whether failure occurs in one of a first region located below the memory cell array in the peripheral circuit and a second region except the first region in the peripheral circuit, when data input/output failure occurs in the peripheral circuit.

column12: AIR COMPRESSOR
column13: PURPOSE: An air compressor is provided to improve the discharge pressure of compressed air discharged from an air tank without increasing the capacity of the air tank. CONSTITUTION: An air compressor(100) comprises a base frame(150), an air tank(110) which comprises an air inlet and a compressed air outlet, a compression pump(120) which comprises an exterior air intake, an air outlet, and a radiating unit, and a shock-absorbing member(160) which absorbs vibration created from the air tank and the compression pump. Air flowing in through the exterior air intake is exhausted via the inside of the radiating unit through the air outlet. The air outlet is parallelly connected to the air inlet of the air tank. The shock-absorbing member comprises a first fixing unit combined with the base frame, a second fixing unit combining with the air tank and the compression pump, and a shock-absorbing part combined between the first fixing unit and the second fixing unit.

column12: THE SYSTEM OF PIPE NDT ROBOT
column13: PURPOSE: A robot system for the nondestructive inspection of pipes is provided to enable a man who is not an expert to perform a nondestructive inspection by transmitting the state data of the pipe, collected by a mobile robot, to a remote control station. CONSTITUTION: A robot system for the nondestructive inspection of pipes comprises robot mechanism units(1,2,3) and a remote control station(4). The robot mechanism units move along the exterior of the pipe. The robot communicates with the remote control station wirelessly. The robot system combines a nondestructive inspection result with the position data of the robot and visualizes data.

column12: RFID TAG FOR HARD LIQUOR ANTI FORGERY
column13: PURPOSE: A radio frequency identification (RFID) tag for prevention of whisky forgery is provided to be attached to the rear of a label tag with an ethylene vinyl acetate (EVA) foam double-sided tape and to operate the RFID tag more stably, thereby improving the reliability of the product. CONSTITUTION: A label tag (2) is provided in the rear of a cover sheet (1) of a paper material and is coated with an antenna printed pattern (22) which includes an RFID integrated circuit (IC) chip (21). An EVA foam double-sided tape (3) and a release paper (4) are provided in the rear of the label tag. The EVA foam double-sided tape has a thin metal sponge material (31). The release paper is attached to the rear of the EVA foam double-sided tape.

column12: CALIBRATION TARGET APPARATUS OF RADAR SENSOR
column13: The present invention relates to a radar sensor calibration target device for maintaining the appropriate distance between vehicles. According to the present invention, the radar sensor calibration target device includes a target board and a control unit. The target board includes: a pair of horizontal rack gear tracks which are placed at the top and the bottom; a first vertical rack gear track which is vertical to the horizontal rack gear tracks; a pair of first X-axis gear boxes which are placed both ends of the first vertical rack gear track, include gears each of which is engaged to each of the horizontal rack gear tracks and motors for driving the gears, and move the first vertical rack gear track in the X-axis direction; and a first Y-axis gear box which includes a first target, a gear engaged with the first vertical rack gear track, and a motor for driving the gear and moves the vertical rack gear track in the Y-axis direction. The control unit controls the motors of the first X-axis gear boxes and the motor of the first Y-axis gear box to control the position of the target.

column13: 본 발명의 일 실시예에 따른 타이어용 센싱 모듈은 타이어 내측면에 배치되는 제1 센서를 포함하고, 상기 제1 센서와 휠 사이의 제1 거리를 측정하는 제1 센싱부, 타이어의 트레드(tread)에 형성된 그루브(groove)의 저면에 배치되는 제2 센서를 포함하고, 상기 제2 센서와 지면 사이의 제2 거리를 측정하는 제2 센싱부 및 상기 제1 센싱부와 상기 제2 센싱부가 장착되며, 타이어의 트레드와 이너라이너(inner-liner) 사이에 설치되는 본체부를 포함한다.

column12: Metod för att skriva data vid provning av minnesanordning och krets för provning av minnesanordning
ELECTRONIC DEVICE AND METHOD THEREOF FOR PROVIDING CONTENT
column13: An electronic device for providing content includes a sensor configured to sense a user input with respect to the electronic device and a controller configured to stop providing the content in response to determining that the electronic device is in a moving state based on the sensed user input while providing the content, and to resume providing the content in response to determining that the electronic device exits the moving state.

column12: A BRAKE OIL LAMP CONTROL STRUCTURE FOR A VEHICLE
column13: A malfunction prevention structure of a brake oil lamp control structure for a vehicle is provided to prevent the brake oil lamp from being turned on and off even when a rolling state occurred if an amount of the brake oil remained in a brake oil reservoir is a steady state. A malfunction prevention structure of a brake oil lamp control structure for a vehicle comprises a floater(20) having a magnet received therein to vertically move in an elevator(12) for the floater, which is installed in a brake oil reservoir(10), and an actuating switch(30) for the brake oil lamp installed at the bottom end of the elevator. The elevator of the brake oil reservoir is provided at both sides thereof with slider transfer portions. A slider(40) having a magnet received therein is installed at each slider transfer portion. Each slider transfer portion is provided at the outside thereof with a rolling detection switch(50).

column12: Delay locked loop circuit
column13: A DLL circuit and a synchronous memory device perform stable operation in a power down mode although the entry and exit into/from the power down mode is repeated rapidly. The synchronous memory device operates in a normal mode and a power down mode. A delay locked loop (DLL) generates a DLL clock having frozen locking information when exiting the power down mode. A controller precludes phase update operation of the DLL when a predetermined time passes after entering the power down mode to thereby obtain a time margin for a phase update operation undertaken in the normal mode.

column12: Heat reflector and substrate processing apparatus comprising the same
column13: A substrate processing apparatus includes a process chamber including upper and lower quartz walls, a substrate support disposed in the process chamber, radiant heaters respectively provided above and below the quartz walls of the chamber, and heat reflectors disposed outside the process chamber for reflecting heat towards the substrate support. Each of the heat reflectors has heating has a first thermally reflective section oriented to reflect the heat towards an outer peripheral region of the substrate support and a second thermally reflective section oriented to reflect the heat towards a central region of the substrate support. Each heat reflector also has a reflection angle adjusting mechanism by which an angle at which the second thermally reflective section reflects heat can be adjusted. The angle is adjusted depending on the temperature distribution across the substrate so that the substrate can be processed uniformly.

column12: DLL CIRCUIT AND METHOD FOR CONTROLLING THE SAME
column13: A DLL(Delay Locked Loop) circuit and a method for controlling the same are provided to perform delay lock operation of a clock stably regardless of potential level variation of a DLL voltage, by controlling the operation of a clock buffer according as determining the enabling of a buffer control signal. An input control unit(1) generates a buffer enable signal from a CKE signal. A buffer control unit(10) generates a buffer control signal from the buffer enable signal by sensing whether a DLL(Delay Locked Loop) voltage exceeds a reference level. A clock buffer(20) generates an internal clock by buffering an external clock if the buffer control signal is enabled.

column12: MANUFACTURING DEVICE FOR REBAR
column13: Disclosed is an apparatus for manufacturing a rebar. The apparatus for manufacturing rebar disclosed in the present specification can block the winding force when the glass fiber is wound, so that the safety of a process can be promoted. Therefore, it is possible to efficiently manufacture the rebar. The apparatus for manufacturing the rebar according to an embodiment of the present invention comprises: a driving unit for transmitting rotational power; a base unit rotated according to the rotational power of the driving unit and has a through-hole communicating with one side and the other side so that the glass fiber can be wound and moved; and a control member disposed on one side of the base unit, in which a reference hole having a diameter set based on the diameter of the wound glass fiber is formed.

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR INTEGRATED CIRCUIT
column13: PURPOSE: A semiconductor integrated circuit is provided to reduce unnecessary current consumption by controlling a current flowing in a signal amplifier. CONSTITUTION: In a semiconductor integrated circuit, a signal amplification part(100) amplifies an input signal. A main current supply unit(210) is operated as the sink current source of the signal amplification part in a first operation mode. A sub current supply unit(220) is operated as the sink current source of the signal amplification part in a second operation mode The first operation mode is an active mode. The second action mode is a standby mode.

column12: Bus system
column13: A bus system for providing a common data transmission path for N data sources that have M data bits. The N data sources are connected to M interconnections correspondingly through N bus cells each of which includes logic circuits for selectively providing the data bits of data sources into the interconnections. The bus cells are controlled to connect each of the data bits of the data sources to the selected one of the interconnections. The bus system is capable of adapting to delay times or loads of the data sources. The bus system reducing the number and the length of the interconnections.

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE AND OPERATING METHOD THEREFOF
column13: The present invention relates to a semiconductor memory device which generates an output enable signal for receiving an internal clock signal, and outputs data using the output enable signal. The present invention provides a semiconductor memory device comprising: an internal clock signal generation unit for generating an internal clock signal corresponding to an external clock signal; a defective operation detection unit for receiving internal operation information of the internal clock signal generation unit and detecting a change in a circuit operation environment to output the change as a defect detection signal; and an output enable signal generation unit which is reset in response to the defect detection signal, and which generates an output enable signal corresponding to CAS latency information when the internal clock signal is received and read.

column12: DELAY LOCKED LOOP CIRCUIT AND SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE USING THE SAME
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a delay locked loop (DLL) circuit which can control the operation of a register controlled DLL circuit by detecting whether or not a phase difference between an input source clock REFCLK and an output delay locked clock DLLCLK reaches a maximum value.

SOLUTION: A DLL circuit includes: a phase comparator 200 configured to compare a phase of a source clock with a phase of a feedback clock and generate a delay locking signal in accordance with the comparison result; a clock delay 220 configured to delay the source clock in response to delay locking signal, output the delayed source clock as a delay locked clock, and activate a delay end signal when delay locking is not performed even after a delay amount has reached a delay limit; a delay replica model 240 configured to reflect a delay time of an actual output path of the source clock at the delay locked clock and output the reflected clock as the feedback clock; and a delay locking operation controller 250 configured to terminate a delay locking operation in response to the delay locking signal and the delay end signal.

column12: TPMS APPARATUS AND METHOD FOR MANAGING TPMS CONTROLLER
column13: According to one embodiment disclosed in the present document, a TPMS controller management device comprises: a control unit setting and controlling a vehicle driving environment condition corresponding to a test case for managing a signal reception rate of a TPMS controller receiving a detection signal from a detection sensor detecting pneumatic pressure information of a tire of a vehicle; and a management unit managing a detection signal reception rate of the TPMS controller.

column12: Write signal input buffer for a semiconductor memory device
column13: The present invention relates to a write signal input buffer, among input buffers of semiconductor memory device, for receiving a write enable signal supplied from the exterior of chip. The present invention provides a write signal input buffer at least having an input stage for receiving a write enable signal supplied from the exterior of chip, logic means for generating a write drive signal as a correspondence signal according to an output signal of the input stage, and a latch portion for latching an output signal of the logic means and including switching means controlled by a drive signal of data output stage circuit on its latch path. Accordingly, normal driving operation is carried out according to input of external write enable signal regardless of the ground noise induced in data output operation, thereby guaranteeing a correct write operation of chip. Operational characteristics related to timing can be improved when the chip is mounted in the system since stable and accurate driving in write operation is obtained. Also, the reliability of semiconductor integrated circuit related to write operation can be improved.

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR APPARATUS
column13: A semiconductor apparatus for reducing unnecessary current consumption disclosed. The semiconductor apparatus includes: a clock signal transmission unit that selectively transmits a clock signal in accordance with the frequency of the clock signal at an operation standby mode. A delay locked loop generates a DLL clock signal on the basis of the clock signal inputted through the clock signal transmission unit. The delay locked loop generates the DLL clock signal during a period where the clock signal is transmitted.

column12: Back light apparatus and control method thereof
METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR DECIPHERING MEDIA CONTENT STREAM
column13: A method, apparatus and system for pre-authenticating ports is disclosed. In one embodiment, an active port facilitating communication of media content between a transmitting device and a receiving device is identified, while the active port are associated with a first High-Definition Content Protection (HDCP) engine. Then, inactive ports that are in idle mode serving as backup ports to the active port are identified, while the inactive ports are associated with a second HDCP engine. Pre-authentication of each of the inactive ports is performed so the pre-authenticated inactive ports can subsequently replace the active port if a port switch is performed.

column12: Method and apparatus for controlling vehicle using tire information
column13: A vehicle control method of an embodiment comprises the following steps of: receiving a wireless signal having information on a tire of a target vehicle located near a purposed vehicle that is a control target; obtaining information on the target vehicle as surrounding information by analyzing the received wireless signal; and controlling the purposed vehicle by using the surrounding information. The vehicle control method reduces accident rate, improves credibility of the purposed vehicle, and is easy to be integrated with a preexisting system.

column12: Patrol system using robot
column13: 본 발명은 자율주행 가능한 로봇을 이용하여 일정의 지역을 감시 및 보안시킬 수 있는 시스템에 관한 것으로서, 자율주행 가능하고 소리, 연기, 가스, 온도변화, 정지물체 또는 이동물체 등과 같은 이상징후를 감지 가능한 로봇을 관리지역에 투입하여, 주기적 또는 이상징후 발생시에 관리지역 내를 순찰하고, 순찰 결과를 원격지에 위치한 사용자의 사용자 단말기에 보고할 수 있는 로봇을 이용한 감시 및 보안 시스템에 관한 것이다. 또한 본 발명은 자율주행 가능한 로봇이 주기적 또는 이상징후 발생시, 스스로 주행하며 이상징후를 감지하고 사용자에게 보고할 수 있는 효과를 얻을 수 있고; 또한 상기 로봇은 다양한 종류의 이상징후를 감지하며 관리지역을 자율주행하며 순찰하기 때문에, 사용자의 특별한 조정없이도 다양한 면적 및 구조를 가지는 관리지역을 이동하며 감시 및 보안이 가능한 효과를 얻을 수 있으며; 아울러 자율주행 로봇이 주기적 또는 이상징후 발생시 사용자에게 즉각 보고 가능하여, 보다 능동적인 감시 및 보안이 가능한 효과를 얻을 수 있으며; 더불어 로봇이 자율주행 중에 이상징후의 요소 중에 하나인 장애물에 가로막히더라도, 주행 경로를 변경하여 계속적인 순찰활동이 가능한 효과를 얻을 수 있다.

column12: Power generator for data line of memory apparatus
column13: The invention provides the power generator includes a bias voltage generator and a voltage clamping circuit. The bias voltage generator receives a reference voltage and generates a bias voltage according to the reference voltage. The voltage clamping circuit is coupled to the bias voltage generator. The voltage clamping circuit receives a supply voltage and the bias voltage and respectively outputs a plurality of data line power to the data transporting buffers by clamping the supply voltage according to the bias voltage. Wherein, the supply voltage is varied between a voltage range, and voltage levels of the data line powers are all constant.

Data output buffer for use in a semiconductor memory device
column13: A data output buffer of a semiconductor memory device having a data output driver comprised of a pull-up transistor and a pull-down transistor includes a precharging circuit for precharging a gate terminal of the pull-up transistor of the data output driver to a power supply voltage level. Precharging the output driver reduces the load on the pumping voltage generator. This feature, together with precharging the pumping voltage generator itself, allow clocking the pumping voltage generator at a reduced clock rate to reduce power consumption without compromising operating speed of the memory device.

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE FOR CONTROLLING ELECTROMAGNETIC INTERFERENCE (EMI)
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a semiconductor memory device suppressing radiation of electromagnetic waves without deforming a DLL clock required in high-speed operation of the semiconductor memory device.

SOLUTION: The semiconductor memory device includes: a DLL circuit for outputting a DLL clock having a frequency within a fixed delay range by changing a phase when detecting an electromagnetic interference by receiving a system clock; and a data output circuit for outputting data in response to the DLL clock.

Delay locked loop circuit and semiconductor memory device using the same
column13: The present invention relates to a delay locked loop (DLL) circuit. The DLL circuit includes a phase comparator configured to compare a phase of a source clock with a phase of a feedback clock and generate a delay locking signal based on the comparison result, a clock delay configured to delay the source clock in response to the delay locking signal for locking delay, output the delayed source clock as a delay locked clock, and generate a delay end signal when a delay amount has reached a delay limit, a delay replica model configured to reflect a delay time of an output path of the source clock at the delay locked clock and output the reflected clock as the feedback clock, and a delay locking operation controller configured to terminate a delay locking operation in response to the delay locking signal and the delay end signal.

column12: Delay locked operation in semiconductor memory device
DELAYED LOCKED LOOP CIRCUIT WITH DUTY CYCLE CORRECTION AND CONTROL METHOD OF THE SAME
column13: A delay locked loop circuit having a function for correcting a duty cycle and a method for controlling the same are provided to prevent errors of a delay locked loop operation due to an abnormal feedback in advance by determining the generation of a duty correction error. A delay locked loop circuit having a function for correcting a duty cycle includes a delay locked loop block(100), a duty cycle correction block(200), and an error determination unit(300). The delay locked loop block generates a first inner clock by receiving an external clock. After the delay locked loop block outputs a plurality of second inner clocks by delaying the first inner clock through an inside delay unit, the delay locked loop block performs a delay lock of a second inner clock by adjusting a delay time of the delay unit according to the phase difference between a feedback signal and the first inner clock. The duty cycle correction block outputs a duty cycle correction clock obtained by correcting duty cycles of a plurality of second inner clocks. The error determining unit feedbacks one among the duty cycle correction clock or the plurality of second inner clocks by determining the generation of a duty correction error according to the phase comparison result.

column12: Voltage boosting circuit of a semiconductor memory circuit
column13: A voltage booting circuit for boosting a supply voltage VCC supplied from a system to a desired boosting voltage VPP level. The voltage boosting circuit includes a transmission transistor formed by a triple-well process. The transmission transistor has bipolar characteristics and operates as a bipolar diode.

column12: BACK LIGHT APPARATUS AND CONTROL METHOD THEREOF
column13: A back light apparatus includes a back light part which emits light to a liquid crystal display panel, and includes a plurality of LEDs respectively corresponding to a plurality of colors, a detecting part which detects the light emitted from the plurality of the LEDs, a driving part which drives the LEDs to emit, and a controller which controls the driving part to make color ratios substantially equal to a reference value if the reference value is not equal to the color ratio between at least two colors among the plurality of colors of the light detected in the detecting part.

column12: System for maintaining period goods for discount
column13: The present invention relates to a system for managing sale goods for a period, and more particularly, to a system for managing sale goods for a period, capable of providing a user with a list of the goods that can be sold by a market and a sale type for each of the goods sold on an online market or an offline market and providing the user with a much lower price than other sellers for a corresponding period by providing the user with a periodical use right for the corresponding goods if the user selects specific goods, thereby providing a customer with the goods with a lower price and providing a seller with the increase in sales and profitability.

column12: Semiconductor memory device and method for operating the same
Heat pump system
column13: The present disclosure relates to a heat pump system. The heat pump system removes heat generated during the generation of electric energy using a power generator and also performs heating using waste heat. Since an additional heat source is created in order to meet a heating requirement, heating control is effectively achieved, and electric power is produced so as to meet the demand of electric energy. When the power generator is likely to be over-cooled in the cold season, cooling of the power generator is stably performed by controlling the temperature and the flow rate of a cooling medium moving to the power generator.

column12: Output control device
column13: An output controller includes a test unit, which can test an appropriate delay amount according to an operating frequency under a real situation. The output controller includes: an output enable signal generator for generating corresponding ones among a plurality of output enable signals based on a preset column address strobe (CAS) latency, each of the output enable signals having information relating to a delay time from an activation timing of a CAS signal; and an output driving signal generator for receiving the plurality of output enable signals corresponding to the preset CAS latency and outputting rising and falling output driving signals for controlling an output timing of data.

column12: Delay locked loop circuit
column13: A synchronous memory device having a normal mode and a power down mode includes a power down mode controller for generating a power down mode control signal in response to a clock enable signal, thereby determining onset or termination of a power down mode. A clock buffering unit buffers an external clock signal in response to the power down mode control signal and outputs first and second internal clock signals. A clock selection unit selects one of the first and second internal clock signals based on the power down mode control signal to output the selected signal as an intermediate output clock signal. A phase update unit performs a phase update operation by using the intermediate output clock signal to output a delay locked loop (DLL) clock signal, the first internal clock signal differing in frequency from the second internal clock signal.
column32: Taiwanese Search Report and Office Action, w/English translation thereof, issued in Patent Application No. 095123948 dated on Aug. 21, 2008.

column12: Semiconductor memory device
column13: A semiconductor memory device has a control circuit capable of properly controlling a delay locked loop in a variety of operational modes. The semiconductor memory device includes a clock buffer for externally receiving a system clock to output it as an internal clock, a delay locked loop unit for controlling a delay of the internal clock such that a data output timing is synchronized with the system clock; a data output buffer for synchronizing data with the delay locked internal clock, thereby outputting the data, and a clock buffer control unit, responsive to a previous operation state, for generating an enable signal controlling the on/off switching of the clock buffer.
