DELAY LOCKED LOOP AND OPERATING METHOD THEREOF
column13: A delay locked loop (DLL) includes a delay-locking unit configured to generate first and second delay clocks corresponding to first and second clock edges of a reference clock for achieving a delay-locking; a phase detection unit configured to detect a phase difference between the first and second delay clocks to output a weight selection signal; a weight storage unit configured to store the weight selection signal obtained during a predetermined period from a point of time when the first and second delay clocks are delay locked; and a phase mixing unit configured to mix phases of the first and second delay clocks to output a DLL clock by applying a weight corresponding to the stored weight selection signal in the weight storage unit.

column12: HIGH TEMPERATURE RFID TAG
column13: The present invention relates to a high temperature RFID tag assembly used in a gas container. The high temperature RFID tag assembly includes an upper case coupled to a lower locking case permanently coupled to an outer periphery of a gas inlet/outlet of a gas container. To remove corrosion generated in the gas container which is determined to be usable through an external inspection, a pressurized test and an internal pressure test of the gas container, when removing paint or corrosion on the gas container by a shot blast, the lower locking case and the upper case are formed by a PPA material so that the cases possess high durability to withstand impact. The lower locking case and the upper case are formed by the PPA material and an RFID tag part is formed by an insulation material so that the gas container withstands high temperature drying at a high temperature and a damage to the RFID tag is prevented so information in the RFID tag, in which information of the gas container is recorded, can always be read.

column12: OUTPUT TIMING CONTROL CIRCUIT AND SEMICONDUCTOR APPARATUS USING THE SAME
column13: PURPOSE: An output timing control circuit and a semiconductor device using the same are provided to stably output an output point of output data in a wide frequency band according to data output delay information. CONSTITUTION: A delay amount counter unit(210) controls a delay amount of an output reset pulse signal according to a frequency of an external clock signal. An operating unit subtracts a code value of a first counting code from the code value of the data output delay code and outputs the subtracted value as a delay control code. A phase control unit(230) controls the phase of a read command signal corresponding to a clock number of a DLL clock signal corresponding to a code value of the delay control code and outputs the controlled signal as an output enable flag signal.

column12: INTEGRATED CIRCUIT
column13: An integrated circuit includes a clock control unit configured to selectively output an external clock or a delayed clock acquired by delaying the external clock as an input clock in response to a divided clock generated by dividing the external clock, when a test mode is entered; and an internal circuit operating in response to the input clock.

column12: DLL circuit and method of controlling the same
column13: A DLL circuit includes a buffer control unit configured to detect whether or not a DLL power supply exceeds a reference level and output a buffer control signal. A clock buffer buffers an external clock to generate an internal clock when the buffer control signal is enabled.

column12: Apparatuses and methods for line charge sharing
column13: Apparatuses and methods for charge sharing, between signal lines are disclosed. An example apparatus may include first and second lines and a charge sharing circuit. The charge sharing circuit may be coupled to the first line and the second line and configured to receive a first data signal and a second data signal. The charge sharing circuit may be further configured to cause charge to be shared between the first line and the second line responsive, at least in part, to the first data signal and the second data signal having different logic levels.

column12: Delay locked loop circuit
Delay locked loop circuit
column13: A DLL circuit and a synchronous memory device perform stable operation in a power down mode although the entry and exit into/from the power down mode is repeated rapidly. The synchronous memory device operates in a normal mode and a power down mode. A delay locked loop (DLL) generates a DLL clock having frozen locking information when exiting the power down mode. A controller precludes phase update operation of the DLL when a predetermined time passes after entering the power down mode to thereby obtain a time margin for a phase update operation undertaken in the normal mode.
column32: Taiwanese Search Report, with English Translation, issued in Taiwanese Patent Application No. TW 095123923, dated Jul. 24, 2008.

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR APPARATUS
column13: PURPOSE: A semiconductor device is provided to reduce an necessary current consumption by stopping a generation of a DLL(Delay Locked Loop) clock signal in not only a power save mode but also operation standby mode. CONSTITUTION: A clock signal transmitting unit(20) selectively transmits a clock signal according to a frequency of a clock signal in an operation standby mode. A delay fixing loop(30) generates a DLL clock signal by receiving a clock signal transmitted through the clock signal transmitting unit. The DLL generates the DLL clock signal during transmission duration of the clock signal. The block signal transmission unit does not transmits the clock signal in a power saving mode. The DLL stores a phase update value of the DLL clock signal.

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR DEVICE
column13: A semiconductor device is disclosed. The disclosed semiconductor device comprises: a delay line including unit delay cells of a first group which are used to delay a phase of a clock by a unit cycle of a reference frequency wherein the reference frequency is a reference for distinguishing between a high frequency and a low frequency; unit delay cells of a second group, which are not used therefor; and a reservoir capacitor formed adjacently to one or more of the unit delay cells of the first group.

column12: Delay locked loop and operating method thereof
column13: A delay locked loop (DLL) includes a delay-locking unit configured to generate first and second delay clocks corresponding to first and second clock edges of a reference clock for achieving a delay-locking; a phase detection unit configured to detect a phase difference between the first and second delay clocks to output a weight selection signal; a weight storage unit configured to store the weight selection signal obtained during a predetermined period from a point of time when the first and second delay clocks are delay locked; and a phase mixing unit configured to mix phases of the first and second delay clocks to output a DLL clock by applying a weight corresponding to the stored weight selection signal in the weight storage unit.

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE AND METHOD OF OPERATING THE SAME
column13: Provided herein are a semiconductor memory device and a method of operating the same. The semiconductor memory device includes: a memory cell array including a plurality of memory cells; a peripheral circuit configured to control the memory cell array, the peripheral circuit including a first region disposed under the memory cell array and a second region; and a fall sensing unit configured to sense whether a failure has occurred in the first or the second regions.

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE HAVING MULTI-INPUT AND OUTPUT LINE STRUCTURE
column13: PURPOSE: A semiconductor memory device having a multi-input and output line structure is provided to prevent noise. CONSTITUTION: A memory cell array(111) stores data. A sense amplifier(121) senses data stored in the memory cell array(111) through a pair of bit lines and amplifies the sensed data. A column selecting line gate(131) responds to the column selecting line signal, and transfers data of the sense amplifier(121) to a pair of input and output lines and transfers data of a pair of input and output lines to the memory cell array(111). A pair of input and output lines are connected to drivers(141,142,151). Drivers(141,142) increase a driving capability of a data (Di) inputted from the outside and transmit the increased data to an input and output line(IO). The driver(151) increases the driving capability of the data (Di) inputted from the outside and transfers the increased data to a complementary input and output line.

column12: NONVOLATILE MEMORY DEVICE FOR PERFORMING DUTY CORRECTION OPERATION, MEMORY SYSTEM, AND OPERATING METHOD THEREOF
column13: A nonvolatile memory device suitable for sequentially performing a ZQ calibration operation and a read operation in response to a ZQ calibration enable signal and a read enable signal. The nonvolatile memory device includes a duty ratio control block suitable for receiving the read enable signal, performing a duty correction operation and setting a duty ratio, in a ZQ calibration operation period, and receiving the read enable signal and outputting a duty-corrected clock based on the set duty ratio, in a read operation period; a clock generation block suitable for generating an internal clock signal in response to the duty-corrected clock; and a data output block suitable for outputting data outputted from an internal memory cell region, in synchronization with the internal clock signal.

column12: PROCEDE PERMETTANT D'ECRIRE DES DONNEES LORS DE L'ESSAI D'UN DISPOSITIF DE MEMOIRE, ET CIRCUIT D'ESSAI DE DISPOSITIF DE MEMOIRE
DEVICE OF PREVENTING BREAKAGE OF DOOR FOR AN AUTOMOBILE
column13: A damage prevention apparatus of a vehicle door is provided to prevent a door of another closely parked vehicle from being damaged and transformed due to impact caused by carelessness of a driver or an occupant. A damage prevention apparatus of a vehicle door comprises: an ECU(electronic control unit)(400) supplying and shutting down power supply according to operation of an operation switch(600), a motor(300) operated by receiving power supply from the ECU, a shock absorption member(100), while being eccentrically rotated according to operation of the motor, which inlets and outlets to inside and outside a door(700), a pressure sensor(200) fixed inside the shock absorption member, and a speaker(500) generating beeping when the pressure sensor senses collision to the door.

column12: EYE PART OF AUTOMOTIVE SUSPENSION FOR IMPROVEMENT OF GEOMETRY INTERFERENCE
column13: An eye part of automotive suspension is provided to allow orbits of a suspension and a steering to coincide with each other in case of geometry interference caused by the position change of a vehicle, thereby improving geometry interference. An eye part of automotive suspension comprises: a pin holder part(10) in which a horizontal guide hole(12) is formed; and a coupling pin part(20) either rotating around a circular hole(11) while shaft-combined with the pin holder part or being guided along the horizontal guide hole. The cylindrical coupling pin part is formed with one end of a plate spring(100) in one body. The length of the coupling pin part coincides with the diameter of the circular hole. The coupling pin part is rotatable within the circular hole. The initial mounting angle of the coupling pin part is 30 degrees on a basis of a virtual perpendicular line on the pin holder part.

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE AND THE METHOD FOR OPERATING THE SAME
column13: A semiconductor memory device and a method for operating the same are provided to perform modulation of an output clock by controlling an output clock of a circuit for correcting duty ratio of a delay locked clock. A modulation clock generator(100) generates a modulation clock. A clock input part receives a system clock and transmits the system clock. A modulation part(210,220) modulates a clock outputted from the clock input part in response to the modulation clock. A delay locked loop circuit generates a delay locked clock by performing delay locking operation by receiving the modulated clock.

column12: HEAT PUMP SYSTEM
column13: The present invention provides a heat pump system that cools heat generated during electric energy generation through a power generator and, at the same time, performs heating using waste heat. In addition, the heat pump system generates an additional heat source when a heating load is generated, thereby enabling efficient heating control and producing electric power according to the required amount of electric energy. Furthermore, the heat pump system maintains stable cooling of the power generator by controlling the temperature and flow rate of a cooling medium circulated to the power generator when there is concern about overcooling of the power generator in winter. The heat pump system comprises a cooling cycle for cooling the power generator with the cooling medium, a first cycle for circulating and selectively supplying a first heat medium, a second cycle for circulating and selectively supplying a second heat medium, and a control unit for controlling the supply of the first heat medium and the second heat medium having a higher temperature than the first heat medium.
column14: HYUNDAI MOTOR CO LTD;;KIA MOTORS CORP

column12: Write-signal input buffer in an integrated semiconductor circuit
column13: The present invention relates to a write-signal input buffer among the input buffers of a semiconductor memory device for receiving a write-enable signal from outside the chip. The present invention provides a write-signal input buffer which comprises at least one input stage for receiving a write-enable signal which is applied from outside the chip, a logic device for generating a write-driver signal as a signal corresponding to the output signal of the input stage, and a holding region for holding the output signal of the logic device, which region also comprises a switching device in its holding path. Consequently, a normal driver operation is carried out according to the input of an external write-enable signal, independently of background noise induced in a data output operation, whereby a correct writing operation on the chip is ensured. The operating characteristics relating to the time sequence can be improved if the chip is fitted in the system, since a stable and accurate driving is carried out during the writing operation. In addition, the reliability of the integrated semiconductor circuit with respect to the writing operation is improved.

column12: CIRCUIT FOR GENERATING DELAY LOCKING CLOCK AND METHOD FOR GENERATING DELAY LOCKING CLOCK
column13: A circuit and a method for generating a delay locked clock are provided to generate a more stable delay locked clock, by preventing the period variation of a high level and a low level and the generation of glitch. In a synchronous semiconductor memory device outputting data in synchronization with a delay locked clock, a clock buffer buffers an external clock into an internal clock. An output buffer outputs data in synchronization with the delay locked clock. A phase comparator outputs a control signal by comparing the phases of the internal clock with a feedback clock, and outputs the control signal by synchronizing the control signal with another edge timing except a reference edge of the internal clock. A delay controller outputs a delay locked signal corresponding to the control signal. A delay line outputs a delay clock by delaying the internal clock as much as delay time responding to the delay locked signal. A delay model outputs the feedback signal by delaying the delayed clock outputted from the delay line as much as the modeling value of the delay value until the external clock is transferred to the output buffer. When the phases of two signals inputted to the phase comparator are equal, the delayed clock is outputted as the delay locked clock.

column12: CPW-FED PLANAR INVERTED F-ANTENNA WITH TRIPLE-BANDS FOR USING MOBILE-PHONE
column13: A CPW-fed planar inverted f-antenna with triple-bands for a terminal is provided to secure a broadband property by easily performing impedance matching and by making distribution of signals low through a CPW-fed. In a CPW-fed planar inverted f-antenna with triple-bands for a terminal, a first radiation patch(11) separated from a ground includes a first area and a second area which are divided by a slot(12) inserted with a predetermined angle(11), wherein the slot(12) is formed at the first radiation patch. A second radiation patch(13) electrically connected to the first area of the first radiation patch(11) is formed so as to have a predetermined angle with respect to the first radiation patch(11). A feeding member(15) is connected to the first area of the first radiation patch(11) electrically and supplies current. And, a short circuit member(16) is connected to the second area of the first radiation patch(11) and the ground.

column12: Method for operating for licensee mediation
column13: 본 발명의 실시 형태는 소비자 단말기가, 사업 테마를 사업자 중개 서버에 전송하는 사업 테마 전송 과정; 상기 사업자 중개 서버가, 사업 테마를 사업자 중개 웹페이지의 사업 테마 리스트에 포함시켜 등록하는 사업 테마 리스트 등록 과정; 사업자 단말기가, 상기 사업자 중개 서버에 접속하여 상기 사업자 중개 웹페이지를 수신하여 표시하는 사업자 중개 웹페이지 표시 과정; 상기 사업자 단말기가, 어느 하나의 사업 테마를 사업자로부터 선택받아, 선택된 사업 테마에 입찰하는 사업 제안서를 상기 사업자 중개 서버에 전송하는 사업 제안서 전송 과정; 상기 사업자 중개 서버가, 수신한 사업 제안서를 사업 테마를 등록한 소비자 단말기에 전송하여 중개하는 사업 제안서 중개 과정; 상기 소비자 단말기가, 계약 체결하기로 선택된 사업자에 대한 정보를 상기 사업자 중개 서버에 전송하는 계약 체결 정보 전송 과정; 및 상기 사업자 중개 서버가, 계약 체결할 소비자와 사업자의 정보를 저장하며, 계약 체결 상대방의 연락처를 소비자 단말기 및 사업자 단말기에게 각각 전송하는 계약 진행 과정;을 포함할 수 있다.

column12: A BURNER STRUCTURE THAT PREVENTS FRIED FLOATING MATTER ACCUMULATING ON THE BOTTOM OF A FRYER OR COOKER FROM BURNING
column13: The present invention provides a burner structure preventing carbonization of a fried floating matter piled on the bottom of cookware or a fryer. The burner structure includes: a burner installed to heat a first area corresponding to the circumference separated as much as a predetermined distance from the center of the bottom of cookware or a fryer by flame of the burner, wherein a part thereof corresponding to a second area is formed in the burner to be penetrated so that the flame of the burner is not in contact with the second area including the center corresponding to the inner side of the first area and the periphery of the center; and a heat sink vertically installed on the upper surface of the burner and having a predetermined height from the inner side than an opening unit launching the flame of the burner so that the flame of the burner is in contact with only the first area but not the second area. The bottom of the cookware or the fryer is formed to be inclined downward toward the center. The first area is farther from the center of the burner than the second area and is higher than the second area based on a ground surface. According to the present invention, the burner structure preventing carbonization of a fried floating matter piled on the bottom of cookware or a fryer can prevent the carbonization of a fried floating matter piled on the center of the bottom inclined when the bottom of the cookware or the fryer is heated by the burner or a heating unit at high temperature. So, the burner structure preventing carbonization of a fried floating matter piled on the bottom of cookware or a fryer enables a user to easily wash the cookware or the fryer by solving a problem in which the bottom gets burned and stuck to be dark, by preventing a phenomenon in which smoke of frying oil is generated.

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR JUDGING POSSIBILITY OF DATA ERROR
column13: The present invention relates to a method and an apparatus for judging the possibility of data error. According to an embodiment of the present invention, the method for judging the possibility of data error includes a step of extracting a row title corresponding to the row of first data or a column title corresponding to the column of the first data inputted to a spreadsheet, a step of extracting the row title or second data corresponding to the column title, a step of calculating a standard deviation for the first data and the second data, and a step of determining whether the first data is error data based on the standard deviation. It is possible to easily recognize the error data even if a user does not directly search for the error data, by calculating the standard deviation of a plurality of data corresponding to the same title and detecting the error data.

column12: Adjustable chemical machinery rack mounting seat
column13: The utility model discloses an adjustable chemical mechanical frame mounting seat which comprises a bottom plate, a hydraulic jack is arranged at the middle end of the lower portion of the bottom plate, and telescopic supporting structures are arranged on the periphery of the lower portion of the bottom plate. A motor is arranged on the bottom face of the bottom plate, the output end of the motor extends to the bottom plate to be provided with a gear, and a driven gear meshed with the gear is arranged at the middle end of the upper face of the bottom plate. A supporting column and a mounting plate are arranged on the driven gear, clamping structures are arranged on the two sides of the upper face of the mounting plate, and a buffering structure is arranged between the opposite side faces of the clamping structures. U-shaped take-up holes are formed in the front side and the rear side of the mounting plate, and wire clamping structures are arranged on the U-shaped take-up holes. According to the structure, lifting, supporting, clamping and angle fine adjustment of the chemical machinery can be achieved, wires of the chemical machinery can be clamped and stored, and potential risks are reduced.

column12: a chuck retainer and a runout tester using the chuck retainer
column13: The present invention relates to a chuck retainer, and more specifically, to a runout tester that enables a testing tool to easily rotate a fixed chuck and stably clamps the chuck without a change in a position of the chuck so as to accurately sense an eccentric state of the chuck. To achieve the purpose, the runout tester comprises: a planar base plate; the chuck retainer installed in an upper portion of the base plate to be installed to allow the chuck to be rotated; a joint arm provided to one side of the chuck retainer; and a gauge installed in an end part of the joint arm.

column12: METHOD FOR MANUFACTURING SEMICONDUCTOR DEVICE
column13: PURPOSE: A semiconductor device fabricating method is provided to stabilize the device characteristic by generating a BJT(Bipolar Junction Transistor) by implementing the ion implantation using the inert gas to the lower part of the element isolation film. CONSTITUTION: Patterning is enforced for domain except for the part in which the element isolation film on the semiconductor substrate(100) is formed and the photoresist pattern is formed. The ion injection process is enforced to the domain in which the STI(Shallow Trench Isolation) process of the above semiconductor top of the substrate is applied to. The element isolation film(104) compartmentalizing the active area of NMOS and PMOS and element isolation region is formed in the semiconductor substrate.

column12: ORGANIC LIGHT EMITTING DIODE DISPLAY DEVICE
column13: Disclosed is an organic electroluminescent display device. The disclosed organic electroluminescent display device of the present invention comprises: a substrate having a plurality of unit sub-pixels including red sub-pixels, green sub-pixels, and blue sub-pixels; a first electrode formed on the substrate; an organic light emitting layer formed on the first electrode; a second electrode formed on the organic light emitting layer; and a capping layer formed on the second electrode, wherein the capping layer comprises an optical adjusting material in which a refractive index is increased as the wavelength of incident light is increased. Accordingly, the organic electroluminescent display device forms the thickness of the capping layer to the same thickness regardless of the sub-pixels, thereby improving productivity and securing the maximum light emitting efficiency for each sub pixel.

column12: SOLDERING DEVICE FOR CAMERA MODULE
column13: According to an embodiment of the present invention, the present invention relates to a soldering device for a camera module comprising: a laser module irradiating a laser beam to a solder ball; a vision system detecting a camera module and a substrate through an imaging device; a stage supporting and aligning the camera module and the substrate; and a controller electrically connected and controlling the laser module, the vision system, and the stage.

column12: METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR DECIDING HARMFULNESS OF SOFTWARE APPLICATION
column13: PURPOSE: A method and a system for determining the harmfulness of an application are provided to automate a harmfulness analysis of the application and to determine the harmfulness with a code analysis, thereby removing the necessary to install the application or a specific module in a cellular phone. CONSTITUTION: A binary conversion unit (110) converts an executable file of an application into a binary code by using a reverse compiler. A target character line detecting unit (120) detects a target character line among character lines capable of being generated by the result of calculating the binary code. The target character line detecting unit includes a binary code analysis unit (122) detecting character lines capable of being generated by performing the converted binary code; and a target pattern character line detecting unit (124) detecting the target character line among the character lines by using normalized character arrangement patterns of the target character line. [Reference numerals] (110) Binary code conversion unit; (122) Binary code analysis unit; (124) Character string detecting unit; (130) Character string transmitting unit; (AA) Application executing file
column14: UNIV YONSEI WONJU INDUSTRY ACADEMIC COOPERATION FOUNDATION

column12: Garbage prefabricated houses with means for removing bad odor
column13: The present invention relates to a temporary garbage collection center with a bad smell removal means. The temporary garbage collection center with a bad smell removal means comprises: a garbage collection house having a pair of support plates having a support installed a lower end thereof and a hollow structure with a door provided on one side thereof, and a roof plate provided on an upper end of the support plate, wherein a front surface thereof is opened; a bad smell removal means having a plurality of chemical containers embedded in the support plates, pumps communicating with the chemical containers, a gas mixer having an inlet communicating with the pumps on one side thereof and an outlet on the other end thereof, a bracket provided across a rear side of the support plates, a plurality of spray nozzles provided on the bracket and connected to the outlet of the gas mixer, and a gas sensor provided on the roof plate; an air curtain provided on lower ends of inner sides of the support plates facing each other; a solar panel system provided on an upper surface of the support plates; and a controller provided on the support plates to control the bad smell removal means, the air curtain, and the solar panel system. A bad smell produced in a temporary garbage collection center of an apartment house such as a multiplex house can be removed. A curtain member can be used to selectively block exposure of a garbage collection box.

column12: LED LED LIGHT ADVERTISEMENT DEVICE
column13: An LED lighting advertising device includes: a body; an LED lighting unit positioned on at least one of an inner edge of the body; a front panel forming a front surface of the body; an advertisement insertion groove which is disposed on one side of the front panel, and into which an advertisement is inserted; a light guide plate disposed on one side of the advertisement insertion groove and irradiated by the light of the LED lighting unit; and a rear panel disposed on one side of the light guide plate and forming a rear surface of the body, wherein the advertisement is inserted into and removed from the advertisement insertion groove. The present invention provides an LED lighting advertising device which can easily replace the advertisements inserted into the advertising device.

column12: A processing tool system
column13: The present invention relates to a cutting tool apparatus for reusable workpiece machining having elastic extrusion means. Especially during manufacturing of a cylindrical structure based on hollowing of a cylindrical workpiece, the inside of the cylindrical workpiece is hollowed in a cylindrical shape, and thus a cylinder allowing material reuse is extracted for a higher level of usability. The cutting tool apparatus for machining is provided with the elastic extrusion means, and thus withdrawal following machining is facilitated and the machining of the reusable workpiece can be expedited and facilitated. The present invention includes a cylindrical or polygonal column-shaped workpiece having a circular or polygonal vertical cross section; rotation and fixing means simultaneously rotating, holding and supporting one side of the workpiece; machining means for machining the inside into a cylindrical shape and coming into contact with the other side of the workpiece at the same time; cutting oil supply means supplying cutting oil through the body of the machining means; and the elastic extrusion means installed on the central shaft of the machining means so that the machining means is easily separated from the workpiece.

column12: Keypad assembly for mobile station
column13: A keypad assembly for a mobile station comprises a base pad adapted to support a plurality of keys, the plurality of keys comprising a plurality of first keys and a plurality of second keys. The keypad assembly also comprises the plurality of first keys and the plurality of second keys arranged on the base pad, the plurality of second keys defined by horizontal center lines and vertical center lines of the plurality of first keys. The plurality of second keys may be further defined by outer perimeters of the plurality of first keys. The keypad assembly may further comprise a strength reinforcing plate coupled to the base pad, adapted to mechanically strengthen the keypad assembly. An alphabetic character may be assigned to each of the plurality of first keys. A numeral may be assigned to at least one of the plurality of second keys.

column12: PHOTOCHROMIC MATERIAL
column13: Photochromic dyes are disclosed. A photochromic dye can include a first photo-reactive group and a second photo-reactive group. A first photochromic reaction can be induced in the first photo-reactive group of the photochromic dye by radiation having a first wavelength, and a second photochromic reaction can be induced in the second photo-reactive group of the photochromic dye by radiation having a second wavelength.
column16: KOREA UNIVERSITY RESEARCH AND BUSINESS FOUNDATION (2009-12-01)

column12: APPARATUS AND METHOD FOR CONTROLLING ELECTRIC DEVICE IN VEHICLE
column13: The present invention relates to a method for controlling software for driving an electronic apparatus mounted on a vehicle. The method comprises the steps of: receiving a data package including a plurality of partial data for updating software for a vehicle; and applying a parallel update procedure or a sequential update procedure corresponding to whether or not first partial data to be updated through the central control device in the data package is included. Therefore, software update time can be reduced.

column12: System and method for providing software updates
column13: The invention relates to a system and method for providing software updates. A system for providing a software update includes a server in which software updates are registered, and a terminal for receiving version information of a software update from the server and performing a software update on the basis of the received version information of the software update, wherein the server includes a version information checking unit for collecting version information of software temporarily stored in the terminal or version information of software installed in the terminal and comparing the version information of the temporarily stored software or the version information of the installed software with the version information of the software update to determine whether to transmit the software update to the terminal.

column12: KEYPAD ASSEMBLY FOR MOBILE STATION.
column13: A keypad assembly for a mobile station comprises a base pad adapted to support a plurality of keys, the plurality of keys comprising a plurality of first keys and a plurality of second keys. The keypad assembly also comprises the plurality of first keys and the plurality of second keys arranged on the base pad, the plurality of second keys defined by horizontal center lines and vertical center lines of the plurality of first keys. The plurality of second keys may be further defined by outer perimeters of the plurality of first keys. The keypad assembly may further comprise a strength reinforcing plate coupled to the base pad, adapted to mechanically strengthen the keypad assembly. An alphabetic character may be assigned to each of the plurality of first keys. A numeral may be assigned to at least one of the plurality of second keys.

column12: Stretchable display device
column13: According to an embodiment of the present invention, disclosed is a stretchable display device which includes a first stretchable display panel and a second stretchable display panel positioned to overlap with the first stretchable display panel. The first stretchable display includes a first elongated substrate with a first length and a plurality of first pixels arranged to be spaced apart from each other on the first elongated substrate. The second stretchable display panel includes a second elongated substrate and a plurality of second pixels arranged to be spaced apart from each other on the second elongated substrate. The first elongated substrate is elongated to have a second length along a first direction. The plurality of second pixels are arranged between the plurality of first pixels on the first elongated substrate with the second length. Accordingly, the present invention can maintain resolution in an elongation process.

column12: ORNAMENT ASSEMBLY
column13: The present invention relates to an ornament assembly, which forms a hook hole for hanging a string and a lock and the like on an object made of fabric or leather and simultaneously acts in itself as an ornament, the ornament assembly comprising: a first body including a fist base which has a first through hole formed at one side thereof, and a first insertion part which is formed to protrude around the first through hole; and a second body including a second base which has a second through hole formed at one side thereof, and a second insertion part which is formed to protrude around the second through hole, wherein the second insertion part is inserted into an inner side of the first insertion part, an inner circumferential surface of the first insertion part is tapered such that a width becomes greater in a direction toward an end, and the second insertion part is elastically supported by an inner side of the first insertion part.

column12: IMAGE SENSOR MODULE AND CAMERA MODULE INCLUDING THE SAME
column13: According to an embodiment of the present invention, a camera module comprises a cover glass to prevent an external foreign material from being introduced to the inside thereof. A case includes a guide unit to guide the cover glass during an assembling process with the cover glass.

column12: USB HOLDER
column13: PURPOSE: A USB missing prevention device is provided to remove waste of time for finding outflow of personal information by lost of an USB and finding an USB. CONSTITUTION: A string is connected between a USB(Universal Serial Bus) and a USB wire holder. The string is drawn from the USB wire holder. A user is able to adjust the length of the string according to a need. The USB wire holder is able to be connected to a portable phone. The total length of string is 1.2m. If the user pulls the string for returning the string back as much as about 1cm and takes his hand off from a ring, the string is wound.

column12: Semiconductor device and fabricating method of the same
column13: A semiconductor device and a fabricating method of the same are provided. The semiconductor device a substrate including an active region defined by an element isolation film, an impurity region having a first conductivity type in the active region, a first semiconductor film of a second conductivity type on the impurity region, a buried insulating film on the first semiconductor film, a second semiconductor film on the buried insulating film, and a well contact connected to the first semiconductor film. The level of a lowermost surface of the first semiconductor film is higher than a level of a lowermost surface of the element isolation film.

column12: PHOTOCHROMIC MATERIAL
column13: Photochromic dyes are disclosed. A photochromic dye can include a first photo-reactive group and a second photo-reactive group. A first photochromic reaction can be induced in the first photo-reactive group of the photochromic dye by radiation having a first wavelength, and a second photochromic reaction can be induced in the second photo-reactive group of the photochromic dye by radiation having a second wavelength.
column14: BUSINESS FOUNDATION KOREA UNIVERSITY RES AND;;UNIV KOREA RES & BUS FOUND

column12: Integrated hospital logistics management system using AI technology, and integrated hospital logistics management method using same
column13: An integrated hospital logistics management system and an integrated hospital logistics management method using same is provided. Artificial intelligence analyzes trends and seasonal trends by using big data and predicts actual usage by using an artificial intelligence technology, and an artificial intelligence system automatically processes reorders, replacements, etc., thereby ensuring that an appropriate safety stock level can be maintained at all times according to a stock quantity, stock state, issue quantity, etc. of hospital supplies. The integrated hospital logistics management system includes an order processing module which processes ordering and warehousing of supplies; a logistics management module which requests the order processing module to purchase or replace the supplies according to the states of the supplies; and a system control module including a machine learning unit which generates and learns rules about the operation of the supplies by using metadata.
column32: Silva-Aravena, et al., Inventory Management at a Chilean Hospital Pharmacy: Case Study of a Dynamic Decision-Aid Tool, Mathematics 2020, 8, 1962, 2020, pp. 1-20 (Year: 2020).;;Office Action issued by Korean Intellectual Property Office in priority application KR 10-2020-0120659, dated Nov. 2, 2020, pp. 1-10.;;Office Action issued by Korean Intellectual Property Office in priority application 10-2020-0120659, dated Jan. 2, 2021, pp. 1-10.

column12: E-MAIL BASED ON ENCLOSED TICKETING SYSTEM AND METHOD USING THE SAME
column13: The present invention discloses an e-mail based enclosed ticketing system and a method using the same. That is, the present invention includes a user terminal that accesses a reservation server through a web or mobile application, checks performance or event information provided by the reservation server, enters e-mail address information and quantity information, and applies for the issuance of a ticket for viewing a desired performance or participating in an event; and a reservation server that provides the performance or event information through the web or mobile application and provides the ticket as soon as payment information corresponding to the ticket issuance information applied by the user terminal is confirmed. The ticket applied by the user terminal can be changed from an inactive state before the payment for the ticket to an activated state after the payment.

column12: MULTIPURPOSE HANDY SHOWER
column13: The present invention relates to a multipurpose handy shower. The multipurpose handy shower, according to the present invention, comprises: a container lid; a concave-convex part of a hand-turned part of the container lid; an inclination angle application part; a container handle part; and a container part. Accordingly, the present invention enables a subject who wants to take a bath or shower or wash a part of his/her body indoors or outdoors to wash a desired part at a desired time by himself/herself or with the help of others.

column12: TIME MAGNET E-LEARNING SYSTEM
column13: The present invention relates to a time magnet e-learning system. An objective to be achieved is to give learners a sense of immersion and allow e-learning content itself to grow on its own so that learners can learn with improved quality by adapting the role of a community to the characteristics of e-learning and providing an effect of real-time communication with each other based on a time concept of playtime instead of an actual time concept. In accordance with one embodiment of the present invention, the time magnet e-learning system includes: an e-learning image content management part storing and managing e-learning image content produced by a lecturer; an e-learning image content reproduction part reproducing the e-learning image content to perform e-learning; and a social e-learning content creation part receiving question content from a learner and answer content from at least one among other learners and lecturers with respect to the corresponding question content during the reproduction of the e-learning image content and then combining the same with the e-learning image content in a time sequence to create social e-learning content.

column12: DISPLAY APPARATUS AND THE USING RESTRICTION METHOD THEREOF
PHOTOCHROMIC MATERIAL
column13: Photochromic dyes are disclosed. A photochromic dye can include a first photo-reactive group and a second photo- reactive group. A first photochromic reaction can be induced in the first photo-reactive group of the photochromic dye by radiation having a first wavelength, and a second photochromic reaction can be induced in the second photo- reactive group of the photochromic dye by radiation having a second wavelength. The second wavelength may be greater than the first wavelength.

column12: APPARATUS FOR PROCESSING FUEL
column13: The present invention relates to a fuel processing apparatus. The fuel processing apparatus may comprise: an apparatus body; a fuel reforming unit disposed in a central part of the apparatus body; a heating unit disposed on an upper part of the apparatus body to heat the fuel reforming unit; a CO shift conversion unit connected to the fuel reforming unit and disposed at a lower part of the apparatus body; and a preferential oxidation reaction (PROX) unit connected to the CO shift conversion unit and disposed at an upper part of the apparatus body. According to the present invention, through the optimal arrangement, heat transfer and cooling efficiency can be improved; a reforming reaction and a CO removal reaction can be conducted in a reliable manner; and the apparatus can be miniaturized.

column12: AGENTS FOR IMPROVING DYE FASTNESS
column13: An agent that is capable of improving dye fastness is provided. The agent includes a compound that includes at least one functional group capable of forming at least one interaction or at least one bond with a fiber or a dye molecule. Also, a method for using the agents to improve dye fastness and a dyed article including the agent are provided.
column16: KOREA UNIVERSITY RESEARCH AND BUSINESS FOUNDATION (2010-03-16)

column12: Cooling Filter for Ciga type Electronic Cigarette
column13: The present invention relates to a cigarette type electronic cigarette cooling filter which is provided in a cigarette type electronic cigarette to cool a high temperature nicotine vapor, can secure a sufficient flow length, and is excellent in productivity and processability. The cigarette type electronic cigarette cooling filter according to the present invention is a cigarette type electronic cigarette cooling filter (10) which is disposed between a hollow tube (20) and a tip filter (30) of the cigarette type electronic cigarette to cool the high temperature nicotine vapor passing through the hollow tube (20), wherein a linear type through-hole (11) is formed in the center of the cooling filter (10), and a plurality of channels (12) are formed in a screw shape along a wall surface of the through-hole (11) so that the nicotine vapor is cooled while the nicotine vapor passing through the hollow tube (20) is flown.

column12: DRINKING WATER INSTANTANEOUS HEATING SYSTEM
column13: PURPOSE: An instant water heating apparatus is provided to minimize energy loss by preheating stored water with the residual water and heat after discharge of high-temperature water. CONSTITUTION: An instant water heating apparatus maintains low temperature of stored water in a hot water storage tank and instantly heats water to be discharged so that the hot water can be produced with low power. A heating element is arranged around the interior or exterior of a hot water discharge pipe and covered with a heat insulation layer(301) in order to keep watertight.

column12: Copying paper feed sensing device for a copying apparatus
column13: A device for sensing feeding of copying papers, which may promptly detect paper jamming and misfeeding occurring at a paper feed route of a copying apparatus, such as a laser printer or a copier, thereby preventing pollution by toner or damage of the apparatus. To this end, the device comprises a ratatable actuator of a circular disk shape having a plurality of slits, a first sensor disposed outwardly of the actuator to sense a paper feed condition, and a second sensor disposed outwardly of the actuator to sense the presence and absence of the paper, whereby both the actual feed state and feed distance of the paper may be promptly detected during feeding of the papers.

column12: SEABED MINING VESSEL
column13: Provided is a seabed mining vessel. The seabed mining vessel includes: a vessel body; a riser extending from the vessel body to a seabed to transport mined ores; a dehydrating part to remove moisture from the ores transported by the riser; a mineral resource selecting unit to select mineral resources from the ores without the moisture; a mineral resource storage tank to store the mineral resources; a horizontal carrying unit installed in the mineral storage tank, lifted in a vertical direction, and rotated in a horizontal direction to carry the minerals in the horizontal direction; and a vertical carrying unit installed in the mineral resource storage tank in the vertical direction to carry the mineral resource in the vertical direction, at least a portion of the vertical carrying unit being exposed to the outside so that the mineral resource is transferred out of the mineral resource storage tank.

column12: METHOD FOR AUTOMATICALLY INPUTTING CALCULATION RESULT IN DATA SHEET
column13: The present invention relates to a method and an apparatus for automatically inputting an operation result in a data sheet. According to the present invention, the method for automatically inputting a calculation result in a data sheet includes the following steps: receiving an operation instruction in an operation instruction input cell; measuring two or more cells, operation performing objects according to the operation instruction in a data sheet based on a location of the operation instruction input cell; calculating number data recorded in the two or more cells based on the operation instruction; and displaying a calculated result value in two or more result cells. The present invention can increase user convenience in inputting a calculation result by receiving a certain text in a certain cell and performing calculation for each row or column of the data sheet.

column12: METHOD FOR FORMING A METAL COATING
column13: The present invention relates to a metal surface film forming method and, more specifically, to a metal surface film forming method of increasing the efficiency by minimizing a process of the existing film treatment. According to the present invention, the metal surface film forming method comprises: a first step of first high-pressure washing a workpiece; a second step of pickling the first high-pressure washed workpiece; a third step of washing the pickled workpiece; a fourth step of performing surface adjustment of the washed workpiece; a fifth step of coating the surface adjusted workpiece with a coating agent; a sixth step of washing the coated workpiece; a seventh step of high-pressure washing the washed workpiece; and an eighth step of drying the high-pressure washed workpiece.

column12: Multi-picture display circuit
column13: In a system in which reduced size pictures from a plurality of sources occupy respective portions of a composite display, the number (4, 9, 13, 16) of pictures may be selected by the user. The selection controls the areas of dual port memory to which signals from the sources are allocated, the whole memory being read for display. The system may be associated with a colour television or video tape recorder. <IMAGE>
